choices: Hungry?
Bloated?
Angry?
Curious?
Lonely?
1.content:
Just above the skyline, a few Pegasus Ponies swoop into view. They bring with them a gust of wind that sweeps back the clouds blotting the air, letting the sun shine down. Your soft, smooth coat bristles at the warmth, and you raise your head up from the patch of grass you had been resting in. Your large, beautiful eyes slowly open and the glow of the misty morning light filters in, shaking off whatever last bits of sleep were still in your mind. A modest yawn escapes your delicately pouting lips, and you stretch, first your rear, then your front. Another soft yawn, more of a sigh really, drifts out of your mouth as your supple limbs relax.

You are a Pony. A simple, earth pony. Your name didn't matter, you moved around a lot, so your name often was whatever you felt it should be at the time. You had a light orange body which looked softer than a creamsicle, atop your head was a curly mane of purple strands, wispy like cotton candy, that hung down both sides of your head. Your tail, poofy and had a tendency to bounce as you walked. Occasionally it would bounce too high, and reveal your puffy pink labia to onlookers, and sometimes even your tightly puckered tailhole. Not that you minded, of course.

This was your first day in Ponyville, and you had fallen asleep just before reaching it in a small forest clearing that overlooked the town. And now, properly rested, you are ready to have your first adventure in Ponyville. You were so eager to meet new friends, and to experience everything this famous small town had to offer. The food was supposed to be legendary, and the Ponies were some of the friendliest around.

But as you walked down the gentle slopping knoll that lead to town, you couldn't help but get a certain something stuck in your head. You found yourself feeling...
1.title: Welcome to Ponyville

choices: Some veggies and fruit!
A savory snack of scrumptious sweets!
Oh no... you're not planning on eating a p-p-pony... are you?
11.content:
Yes, that's it! You're very hungry!

Being the silly pony that you are, you completely forgot to pack food for the trip over, and are practically starving! In the last town you visited, there were so many delicious things to eat, just thinking about it makes your mouth water. And Ponyville is renowned for its cuisine! Oh boy, you can barely wait!

You go from a slow trot into a full blown gallop and sprint into town, only stopping briefly to ask for directions to the market square. From there, it's easy to scope out the various restaurants available. You lick your soft lips, your belly was practically audible even in the busy bustle of the afternoon shoppers.

Glancing around, you spot a few choice shops. Ponies mostly eat two things, vegetation and sweets, Ponyville had plenty of both. You think you're in the mood for...
11.title: Got the munchies?

choices: A mare in a cowboy hat
A large red stallion with calm eyes
A little redheaded blankflank filly.
111.content:
The bright sun shining on you and the fresh air blowing through your mane has certainly put you in the mood for some of nature's finest! An orange haired pony seems to be selling carrots and carrot juice, so you stop by her first.

"Hello there Miss!" She says, with a warm smile, "Interested in some of Carrot Top's Carrots?"

"Yes please!" You say, "I'll take two of your freshest, and a cup of Carrot juice too!"

Carrot Top turns to the wagon of veggies behind her stand and grabs two bright orange veggies, holding them in her teeth by the greens. She slaps them down on the counter, and nudges a paper cup over to a jug containing the creamy orange brew. She bites down on the tap, the juice flows out, and she passes the cup over as well. You're just about to reach into your saddlebag to pay, when Carrot Top asks,

"Hey, are you from around here?"


"Oh, no, I'm Orange Cream. I just arrived here today."

"Well shoot, consider these on the house!"

You smile and scoop up the snacks, carefully placing the cup on your back to carry it. After thanking the kind mare, you find a nice little spot by a tree to enjoy them. And you do enjoy them. You start on one of the carrots, and get a little too excited, nearly choking on it. You slow your pace, savoring the feeling of the carrot chunks sliding down your throat. They were rich and crunchy, the best carrots you'd ever had, and so delicious your mouth was overflowing with drool.

You grab the cup with your teeth, and tilt your head back, guzzling down the sweet juices. The carrot juice washes down the meal nicely, and you let out a satisfied sigh. Though you're not entirely full yet.

You look around the marketplace for another veggie stand, but instead come across an apple cart, one without an owner. You glance up one side of the market, then the other, and no one in sight seems to take notice of the unmanned cart. Taking advantage of the opportunity, you snatch up an apple in your mouth, and are surprised by how deliciously juicy they turn out to be! This place has the best produce around, you have to say. You throw your head up and catch the apple in your mouth, crunching it with one quick bite. Sweetest thing you've ever tasted, without a doubt. You wipe some of the drool and applejuice from your lips, and are just about to leave when you hear,

"What in tarnation do you think you're doing stealing mah apples?"

You freeze up, caught red-handed as it were. You turn around to your captor, who is...
111.title: The healthy choice!

choices: Go up to Sweet Apple Acres. Those ponies sound interesting to use.
Say you're going up, but browse around town for other subjects.
Stay with Applejack, she could help you with some 'issues'.
1111.content:
It's a mare with a bright orange hide and VERY strong looking muscles. Running or trying to resist would be useless against her physique. Freckles dot the area below her green eyes which stare at you expectantly. Her straw yellow mane has been tied back and a dusty cowboy hat shades her entire face, adding a hint of malice to her annoyed expression.

"Ah said: What do you think you're doing, missy?"

You step back and apologize profusely. "I didn't mean to steal the apple. I just wasn't thinking! Please, please forgive me."

The mare crosses her forelegs impatiently and taps her hoof. "The apple, sugar?. Sweet Apple Acres don't pay for itself."

You feel yourself blush, and you face down to keep her from seeing. "Okay, I just... Let me get my bits. I'm sorry, I'm from out of town." You turn to your saddlebags. "My name is Orange Cream by the way."

"And I'm Applejack. Shame we started out on this hoof." Applejack becomes quiet as you dig through your bags, searching for your bag of bits. You put it right next to the large 'package' you keep secret from everypony. A smile crosses your face as you think about your good times you've had with other ponies using it. Wait a minute, the wallet's gone! It's just missing! You feel fear rise in your throat and you hurriedly shuffle through the rest of your possessions for any hint of your wallet. A thought strikes you; you must've left it by Carrot Top's stand!

You slowly withdraw your head and give Applejack your best innocent smile even as your heart keeps racing. Applejack is staring at you, flicking her eyes between your cutie mark and your face. A hoof was raised, almost as if in response to something you said. Her expression is moving somewhere between confused and concentrating, jaw opening and shutting. Just as you're about to break the awkward silence, she blurts out, "You related to an Orange Sherbet by any chance? A real fancy filly? Mane rightly like an orange?"

You might never have heard of her, but Applejack has. If this 'Sherbet' mare is on her bad side and you claim to be related... But this is too good a chance to give up. Ingratiating yourself with Applejack has too many perks. She's a business filly, a native, and seems to be quite the fighter. And her body looks... fun to work with.

You try and sound calm as you say, "Oh, yes! That's my, um, aunt."

A grin spreads itself across Applejack's face and her face brightens up. "Well, by Celestia's throne, same for me! You don't worry about paying now! We Apple folks take care of each other, no matter how thin the blood." A wave of relief washes over you, but you're still a bit worried. If she presses for information, you'd be at a loss, and she'd see through you in an instant! You can't blow this now!

You turn away and say, "Well, this has been nice and all, but I really need to get going. No accommodations and all." It's true; you've been forced from town to town, and haven't had a chance to find a cover for this one yet. It's one of the reasons you never take one name. Applejack seems to be perfect for this.

Applejack give you a sideways stare. "You don't have a place to stay? I thought Auntie and Uncle woulda sent you to be at Sweet Apple Acres. We'd be more'n happy to have you."

This just gets better and better. Even so, you instinctively flinch and rush to think of a comeback. "Well, uh, they don't know I'm here. And let me tell you that that is a GOOD thing." You throw in a few conspiratorial winks. "And I'd be happy to stay with you, Applejack." A trusting contact, an unsuspecting population, AND a base of operations? You've hit the jackpot with Ponyville.

Applejack kicks at the cobblestone and looks you over with a concerned expression. "Well now that's a sad, twisty sort of fate. We'll cover for ya. Sweet Apple Acres is in the hills off that-a-way." She gestures to your right. "You can go up and meet Big Mac and lil' Applebloom now, but I'd really like to hear about how Auntie Orange is doin' in Manehattan."

This is almost too perfect. What should you do now?
1111.title: A mare in a cowboy hat

choices: Spend some time with Big Mac
Use the "Device" on Applebloom
11111.content:
"You know, I'd love to but I just wanna get comfortable over at the farmhouse. You know, drop my bags off and such? I have been carrying 'em a while."

"Oh, shoot, a course, cuz." Applejack says, "Go on, I'll catch up with you. I've got a lot of product to move, Granny Smith'd have my hooves if she heard I was chatting it up with a cousin 'stead of selling apples."

The mare then turns and places her body under the harness of the apple cart, pushed her body upwards and pulling the cart up onto its wheels. She also gives you a splendid view of her well-toned flank, glistening with sweat, as it flexes upwards to hold up the weight of her product. You leave Applejack with a friendly wave as she returns to her apple selling. If she was pointing you the right way, this "Sweet Apple Acres" should be nearby. The path starts sloping uphill and you notice apple trees dotting the sides of it. You must be getting close. Before you can go much further, though, you're accosted by a bite-sized yellow filly who scrambles from the grove covered in bee stings and panting for breath.

She notices you, however, and is suddenly able to ignore the numerous itchy welts on her flank, "Heya, ya new here? Ah'm Applebloom! You here fer the apple pickin'? Ah'd love ta help ya but ah gotta get mah Cutie Mark fer beekeepin' so-"

"Oh no dear," You fake your most polite voice, "I'm your cousin, Orange Cream. Applejack sent me here, I'm going to be staying with you guys for a while."

From the look on Applebloom's face you'd think you would have told her Christmas was coming early this year. She jumped into the air and clicked her hooves together happily. She's running around you and asking a million questions. You could hardly keep up with the precocious little darling. Thank goodness another pony showed up before this little dynamo ran you ragged.

"'Scuse me Miss, is lil' Applebloom giving you trouble?"

Well, to call this hunk a pony was certainly an injustice. He was enormous, maybe twice your width, measuring from his broad shoulders. His body was knotted with muscles from countless days spent on this orchard. Most notable was his neck, thick as your hind leg, and his toned flanks. You certainly wouldn't mind sinking your teeth into those apples.

You flip your hair back a bit, just to make sure you were looking good. You tell him, "Oh, this little sweet thing, she's not bothering me at all. I just told her-"

"She's Orange Cream, an' ar cousin!" Applebloom interjects, "She's gonna live with us now!"

"Well shoot," The stallion says, "Name's Big Macintosh. How about we get you to your accommodations so you can settle in?"

"Uh, heh, yeah.. That'd be great." You say, trying(struggling more like) to sound articulate. He gets close to you, very close for someone who you're pretending to be related to. You can actually feel his breath blowing through your hair.

"You know you're a cute lil' thing." He says, "Maybe you'll be bunkin' with me."

Holy horseapples. You're so turned on right now that you don't care that Big Mac apparently has no problem with fucking his cousin. Just when things were about to get juicy, though, a certain yellow filly springs up between you both.

"Hey, are we going or what? Don't tell me yer flirtin' with her already!" She asks.

Big Mac blushes, "Applebloom, git outta here! Go back to messin' around with Honey Suckle's beehives will ya?"

Applebloom blows a raspberry at Mac, and he fumes over, stomping his hooves. The whole display makes you nearly break down laughing, but you have to keep your mission in mind. Big Mac'd be a hell of a lay, and getting him on your side would be useful. And even if you can't get him to help you, a good fuck will tire him out enough to make disposing of him much easier.

On the other hoof, Applebloom's a nubile young filly. Curious enough to try anything, if those beestings are any indicator. She's be perfect for your little "package" you keep handy. In fact, if you play your cards right you could have quite a bit of fun using that "device".

Decisions, decisions...
11111.title: Picking a bunch of apples

choices: Go into the barn and see what punishment Applejack recieves.
Go away with Apple Bloom to test your "package".
111111.content:
This handsome stallion is just too much, you can only imagine what he'd be like in bed. You feel yourself getting moist just by looking at him. After all, you can do whatever you want with Apple Bloom when you're done with Big Mac. He'll be no danger to the two of you when you're done, you'll make sure of that.

You're just about to say this to them when you hear a familiar voice coming from behind you.

"Hey there, sugarcube. Whoa nelly it's good to see you." It's Applejack, she came back early. "I quit early, I know I said granny Smith would have my hooves, but I don't think she'll notice. It's just so nice to have you here so I couldn't wait."

You feel flattered, but this seems awfully risky. Granny lives on this farm, right? She must notice if Applejack comes home. Somehow you don't think Applejack thought this through. You panic a bit, if she's found out and something happens you'll be responsible. You're the reason she quit early after all.

"Applejack, you need to go back. Trust me, I'll be fine!" You say with a bit of panic in your voice.

"Nonsense, the apples can be sold tomorrow, I just wa..." Applejack is cut off mid sentence by a voice that sounds like it comes from a very old pony.

"Applejack, why aren't you in town?" You see Applejack's eyes widening and her whole body going tense. She begins to sweat and mouths to you without making any sounds "Your fault".

"I just wanted to go home and visit my cousin. See here, this is my cousin. I thought that the apples could wait when we had relatives over." Applejack is stuttering, the old pony must have her in an iron hoof.

"Big Macintosh, tie your sister down". You see the old pony now for the first time, she looks so sweet. She reminds you of your own grandma, but green. Your grandmother is orange, as yourself. Even when ordering this she has this sweet look and voice. "You know what the punishment is for leaving your duties, right Applejack?"

"No, please. Don't. I love you granny, please don't do this to me." Applejack breaks into tears and begins to run. Unfortunately she's no match to Big Mac, who tackles her down after running just a couple of seconds. He pins her down with his enormous body. You're horrified by the display, what's granny Smith going to do with poor Applejack? Even though you're feeling this horror, you can easily tell why you fell for Big Macintosh now. His muscles are shining when he holds down his little sis and he looks very sexy. You feel attracted towards the display, the handsome stallion looks like he'd be an animal in bed. Applejack begins screaming, but Mac muffles her scream with his hoof. Her tears are flowing out of her eyes and all you can hear is her muffled screams.

"Apple Bloom, get my rope" Big Mac says to the filly. She looks like she's about to cry, but you guess that she's as clueless as to what's about to happen as you. She obeys, though, and is soon back with a long piece of rope. Mac takes it and begins to tie Applejack's hooves together, when he's done there's no chance for Applejack to move even an inch. As a finish, he ties her mouth together so she's unable to scream. Before he does that, though, she says one last thing between Mac taking his hoof of her mouth and the rope going around her snout. "Granny, there weren't many people there today. I thought I'd be nice to our guest. please don't do this. You don't have to, I only did it to be nice." You have never heard such panic from a pony before, it upsets you. What's going to happen? The worst part is that it's all your fault. If you hadn't tricked Applejack, she wouldn't be in this trouble.

"You fucking imbecile, we need to sell apples to stay alive. Do you realize what you've done? Take your punishment like a good pony. Big Macintosh, take her into the barn." The red stallion nods his head and lifts the heavily crying Applejack onto his back and trots into the barn with Granny Smith following.

When they get out of view you don't know what to do. Should you go watch what happens to Applejack? On the other hoof, you're completely alone with Apple Bloom now. There's little chance of them finding out if you sneak away with the filly.
111111.title: Interrupted plans

choices: Go to Applejack and help her.
Fuck Applejack, she got what she deserved. Letgo search for Big Macintosh.
1111111.content:
No, the filly will have to wait. Your curiosity gets the best of you and you decide to check out what happens inside that barn. You don't want Apple Bloom to follow, so you tell her to go to her room. She obeys, she moves very slowly and her back is slouched. She looks like she's about to break into tears at any time. You don't have time for her now, though. Things are happening in the barn.

You trot over to the barn and try to look for a way to see inside without them seeing you. It's an old barn, and of course there's a crack that makes it possible to see inside. The barn is in really bad shape, it looks like it hasn't been used in years. The crack is big enough for you to see inside easily. You see Applejack lying on the floor. She's shaking and still crying, but she's unable to move an inch, those ropes are really tight. She looks like she has a black eye. You can soon see why, since Granny Smith comes up to her and stomps her in the stomach. She must have done the same thing to Applejack's eye.

"You fucking bitch, leaving the stand like that. You're a real retard aren't you?" She asks and spits Applejack in the face. She doesn't even care, she just continues crying and you hear more muffled screams. There's no telling what she really wants to say, though. And it doesn't seem like Granny wants to hear. She asks Big Macintosh: "Are you ready yet?" "I can't find the axe, give me a minute."

The axe? This might be worse than you thought. But you see Mac bending over when he searches in a box. His well-toned flanks turns you on. Then he turns around with a woodspony axe in his mouth. The blade looks rusty, like it hadn't been used in a while.

"Gwwt wwt!" He said. "Spit it out if you're going to talk." Granny Smith answered. He spits out the axe and says "Got it. Are we ready to begin?" "I think so"

Applejack's eyes start darting around the room, they look at the axe, then Big Mac, then Granny Smith. Her terror is overwhelming. Her screams sound louder, it's almost as if the rope doesn't stop the sounds any longer. She begins shaking her head frantically, it looks like she's pleading for them not to do this.

"Get her into the position and then begin the procedure." Granny Smith says and look at the red stallion. He nods and takes Applejack's rope in his mouth and drags her to a form of wooden contraption that you've never seen before. He opens it up and puts her hooves in there. Then he locks them in place. It must be some kind of stocks. But instead of just standing on your back hooves and your front hooves being stuck in place, Applejack lies on her side and all her four hooves are stuck in this contraption. She tries to get away, but she's stuck. Big Macintosh goes back to where they were standing and picks up the axe before walking back to where they were just standing.

"I told you I'd have your hooves for this." Granny says before gesturing to Big Macintosh to begin. Applejack's eyes are fixed on Granny Smith and you can clearly see the tears rolling down her cheeks. She then looks over to Big Macintosh, who is getting into position. He raises the axe and Applejack closes her eyes. The next second Big Macintosh cuts Applejack's front hooves off with one clean swipe. You have never heard such screaming. Applejack tries her hardest to scream, but the rope is keeping her mouth shut. She's hyper-ventilating. Big Mac repositions himself and proceeds to cut off Applejack's back hooves.

Applejack is screaming like a crazy pony. Her hooves are cut off and blood is getting everywhere. She's stopped crying, the pain is probably too much. Granny Smith looks displeased and goes up to Applejack's face to give her a slap on the cheek.

"Shut your bitch mouth, you know you deserve this." Applejack looks up to her grandmother and begins crying like she hasn't done before.

"Bandage her legs, she shouldn't die." Granny Smith says to Big Macintosh, who takes a first aid kit. He carefully puts bandage on the remainder of her legs, where her hooves once was. The blood stops flowing out of the stumps and Granny Smith leaves the barn. Big Macintosh hits Applejack over the mouth one time and then unlocks the stocks.

"You know why we did this, we warned you." Is the last thing he says before leaving. Applejack rolls over to the other side, the ropes fell off when her hooves came off. But she just rolls over her other side and lies there. The rope is still over her mouth, so you can't hear any words. You can only hear the heart-wrenching cries of this once proud earth pony.
1111111.title: What will happen in the barn?

get some rest applejack was heavy any your tired.

you hear the barn doors swing open and quickly duck behind a barrel as to not draw attention to yourself. you watch carefully as granny smith and big mac walk out of the barn and disappear in the apple orchard. you quickly run into the barn where poor applejack was lying in a puddle of her own blood crying in pain. it broke your heart into a million pieces. you waste no time and run over to her.

you are soon stopped by two small filly's a purple haired Pegasus and a white pink haired unicorn. seeing the body on your back they both scream.

You need to do something about Big Macintosh before anypony else.
111111111.content:
The device? Rot the device! You can use it on somepony else, but first, there's the matter of Granny Smith and Big Macintosh mutilating their kin. You may not be family of theirs, and what you had planned for them may not have been entirely saintly, either, but you do have morals and standards, and this is just intolerable. So they need to sell their apples to survive. That's no reason to cut her hooves off! They'll pay, you tell yourself as you stalk back in the direction you just came from, doing your best to look like nothing's going on at all, They'll all pay. All three of them. It's not for any loyalty to Applejack, of course, you don't know her, but some actions just cannot go unpunished.

You're exhausted from carrying the mare into town, but avenging her is more important to you than rest right now. You arrive back at Sweet Apple Acres and look around a bit more closely than you did earlier, looking for the best places to set up ambushes and also for your three targets. It's possible they know Applejack isn't in the barn any longer, or perhaps they know you're not kin of theirs and are looking for you. The old nag would know who was family of hers, so you go to the most secluded section of the farm you can find and in addition to hoping nopony finds you, you begin making your plans for vengeance. Granny Smith is old and Apple Bloom is young, they'll be easy to overpower. Big Macintosh, however, is not so easy to apprehend. You could deal with the old nag and filly first, or you could somehow deal with the big stallion first. Either way, the goal is the same: Cut off their hooves and leave them to bleed to death.

After some deliberation and planning, you decide...

"Alright, let's get this over it," Casually you had entered the main housing choosing to carry an axe on top of your back. The alternative is to grab it with your front hooves and then assume the bipedal position, but your combat training favorite quadruple position instead

You smirked to yourself remembering the training and the mountain of the paperwork that you will have to do because of it, but that is for tomorrow me to worry about

The search took some time but eventually you found who you've been looking for. The house had been separated into two sections, utility bottom floor and the bedrooms the upper floors. An old but convenient design you though to yourself

"Let's see there are four residents in the house plus a room for a guest... And that means..." You then entered the very first room on the left and then blinked. The old witch was really there and sleeping none the less. I guess they didn't really expect me or anypony else to come over and kill them.

You pulled the Axe handle in the grip of your hooves took careful aim to hit the sleeping pony's back and then swung it The blade made a a wet sound when it hit the flash and then another duller knocking sound when it hit the spine. The bones shuttered and then the old mare's body meekly relaxed.

"Alrighty then", with the satisfactory node that the old witch is paralyzed you perforned a quick surgery to remove her hooves. "Perfect!" The old fart will bleed herself to death. You frowned to yourself because now is the time to deal with the last target.

You came over one of the rooms and then opened, by luck the small filly was inside. You decided to have a little fun and then decided to wake her up.

"Wakey wakey, " you then pulled the small filly by the mane and then threw her body hard across the wall.

You heard an audible groan of the filly, her eyes slowly risen to see that the barrel of the large gun had been pointed to her face. She gasped, it would seem that she recognized you.

"Now then why don't you give me a bloody reason for me to not blow your brains the fuck over."

Twenty seconds passed....
11111111121.title: Granny Smith

choices: Time to take her home, and take care of the rest of the Apples.
Time to meet Applebloom's friends. Nopony should worry about Cutie Marks
111112.content:
"Did you say applepicking?" You're certain that young Applebloom would make the perfect subject. So perfect, in fact, that you couldn't wait a minute more to get her alone. She seems eager enough to get away from the protection of her older brother.

"Sure did," She says, "We got a whole orchard a ripe red apples jus' waitin' ta be picked!"

"I haven't been applepicking in years!" For once you're not lying, but it shouldn't come as a surprise that an individual such as yourself doesn't have time for applepicking. "Do you think we could go right now?"

"Yeah!"

You match her beaming smile for a moment, before unhitching your saddlebags and letting them drop to the ground. Of course, you snatch up your little package, and slip it into the pocket of your coat. Can't forget that, you'd certainly have trouble accomplishing your mission without it! You turn to Big Mac,

"Big Macintosh, could lend a hoof and take my bags in for me? If you could. In fact, take them up to your room, will you?" You punctuate your point with a saucy little wink. Big Mac smiles and nods. You watch him leave with your bags, along with any hope of little Applebloom getting away from you. Silly stallions, always thinking with their balls.

"C'mon Orange, them apples ain't gonna pick themselves!"

"Coming Applebloom!"

...


"This one looks real good, dont'cha think Orange?"

"Mmhmm." You're not exactly focusing on the apples.

"Normally we buck 'em, but that's way too quick. All the fun's in pickin' 'em by hoof, ya know? It takes a while, but it's an experience! Course you know that, you said you've been applepickin' right? Jus gotta climb up and snatch 'em off of Mr. Tree! Don't worry, he won't miss 'em!"

You barely heard a word she said, you were too busy planning. You should have brought a bottle and a blanket, she'll need it soon. Maybe a pacifier too. Shoot, you left all of those in your bags! Hopefully Macintosh won't go snooping around in your things. Goodness, that would be embarrassing.

While you weren't paying attention, Applebloom took the liberty of climbing up into the apple tree. She's already tossing apples into the wooden bucket below.

"I gotta tell ya, I sure love applepickin'! Oh my gosh, maybe that's mah special talent!" Applebloom tries to look at her flank while standing on the ladder and takes a nasty tumble. Thankfully she landed in her bushel of apples, unharmed but a little disoriented. Her butt's sticking up in the air, though. Still blank as the day she was born.

"Aw horseapples. I'll never get mah Cutie Mark."

"Don't be upset, sweetie. There's no need to rush these sort of things." You say. You honestly meant that, you've seen too many fillies waste half their foalhoods trying to grow up. It breaks your heart. Good thing you showed up to save Applebloom from herself.

"But all the other girls cept me and Scootaloo and Sweetie Belle gots their Cutie Marks! We'll be dumb little fillies forever!"

Hmm, Scootaloo and Sweetie Belle. Two names you'll have to keep in mind.

"Shush now Applebloom," You offer your hoof to her and she uses your help to climb out of the apples, "Some of the best things in life are kiddie things! Here, let me show you."

You let the brown paper package fall from your shawl onto the grass. You lean down and pull the string from it, letting the paper fall aside. Inside is a tiny little rattle, a bit of plastic filled with beans that a little foal would play with. It's decorated with caricatures of Celestia and Luna, dancing in the day and night respectively. Applebloom looks at it like a piece of roadkill.

"What're you doin' with a rattle?"

"Oh, it's not what I'm doing, it's what you're doing! Shake it!" Applebloom doesn't move, so you nudge the rattle closer to her with your nose, "Go on! Shake!"

She picks the rattle up in her mouth, clearly uncomfortable about doing so with a foreign object. She shakes it a little and hopes that'll be enough, but your smile urges her onward. She shakes again. She's unaware of how the rattle is starting to glow, nor does she notice that it's getting much harder to think about the stresses of not having a Cutie Mark. In fact, she's not thinking about anything besides the pleasant sound the rattle is making. In under a minute, Applebloom is gone. She's surrendered entirely to the magic of the rattle. The little magical toy slips from her mouth and she falls backwards onto her flank.

"Heehahah! Fun! Fun!" She claps her forehooves together, giggling like a madmare. "Funny noise!"

She's gone now. She's all yours, and she won't be worrying about those awful classmates of hers or a Cutie Mark that she'll never get. She has no cares now, you'll care for her. You scoop her up and hold her in your forehooves as she blows bubbles with her spittle. You hold her like this for sometime, relishing the feeling of being a mother again. But you can't sit around all day, you've got work...
111112.title: Act your age!

choices: ...terrified!
...confused?
1111121.content:
With Apple Bloom happily burbling in your arms, you head out of the orchard and up the hill to the grand farmhouse where the Apple Family is waiting for you. Before getting too close, you stop by the side of the road and rub some dirt onto Apple Bloom's face to make her seem as if she had taken a tumble, then mussed her mane to help promote the image. Then you take a small, rough stone and push it against Apple Bloom's head, grinding it right behind her ear to create a nasty scrape. Apple Bloom starts to sniffle from the pain, but you look her in the eyes and gently shush her. You have such a way with foals. You do a similar job on yourself, making it look like you've both had a rough time apple apple picking.

Satisfied with your appearance, you take a deep breath and break into a sprint towards the door. You shout,

"Help! Help! Big Macintosh! Apple Bloom's been hurt!"

The front door swings open, but instead of Big Macintosh, a young mare is standing there. She catches sight of you and shouts back

"Land's sakes! What happened to her!"

You sprint up to the door and the mare steps aside to allow you in so that you could place Apple Bloom on a comfy looking chair. The commotion attracts two other ponies, an old mare and Big Macintosh. Doing your best to feign worry, you explain through shallow breaths that,

"Oh! It was tragic! Poor Apple Bloom and I were picking apples when she got too excited and fell off the ladder! Oh! And she smacked her head on the ground and she was dizzy for just a moment, but when she came to she was babbling on like a child and playing with a rattle she found in the dirt."

"Wattle!" Apple Bloom adds in, exuberantly shaking her toy.

"Sweet Celestia!" says the mare, "Y'here that Granny Smith? Apple Bloom's all knocked around in the head."

"Goodness me, lemme take her! Applejack, bring her here so I can take a look at our sweet little filly."

You pick Bloom up and pass her to Applejack, who passes her to Granny Smith. The old mare looked up and down Apple Bloom, finding the bump you left on her head. Granny touches the little bruise and Bloom cries out, though she quickly calms down.

"Hmmm," the old mare nods slowly, "she must have taken an awful strike to the head, probably delirious. We'll have to get a good meal in her belly and some rest so she can recover her head. Missy," she addresses you, "would you mind fetching the apple pie from the kitchen. It should still be nice and warm. Good eatin's for a little foal like this..."

"I'm hungry too." Says Big Mac, "can you fix me up a slice?"

"Big Macintosh!" His granny scolds, "t'think you'd be so greedy..."

"Actually Granny, we'd been out all day." Applejack adds in, "I could definitely go for a slice myself."

"I'll bring the whole pie," you chime in, wanting to avoid conflict. The Apples all seem to agree and you trot off to fetch the pie. On your way, you stumble across your bags. Big Mac, that red lummox, didn't even bring them to your room like you asked! Ah well, it'll be much easier to forward you plans this way. You take just a moment to retrieve a small vial in the shape of a baby bottle, filled with a translucent green fluid. When you get you get your hooves on the pie you add a few droplets. That's all you'll need. You return to the apples and they happily begin in on the pie(except for Granmy of course, who is feeding Bloom.)

It takes mere minutes after AJ and Macintosh finish their pie for the potion to take effect. Both of them begin to shrink, until Mac's bridle is big enough to fit over both of them. Foals! Both of then are perfect little foals! Of course, Granny Smith noticed the transformation. And she's...
1111121.title: The new Apple Family

choices: "It's okay Mrs. Smith, just take a rest and everything will be fine." (Lie)
"Well... you see..." (Expose your plan)
11111212.content:
As Applejack and Big Mac shrink to foal size, you intently watch with a small smirk on your face as the old mare looking after Applebloom quickly trotted up to the newly regressed Applejack and Big Mac and rubbed her eyes in slight disbelief.

"What th- did ma' eyes go funny again or are ya' both smaller?" Granny Smith shoved her head into the faces of Big Mac and Applejack and squinted at the foals, something irked you as Granny got close to the foals, only YOU should be the one to look after and handle your precious little foals, not this old mare.

Your plan is perfect, now all you need to do is get rid of Granny Smith and you'll have a house and new foals all to yourself, you quickly trot up to Granny Smith and place your hoof onto her backside and lightly tap her. You watch as Granny quickly got up to take a look at you with a strange expression on her face, the expression of slight confusion on her face as if her old brain wasn't up to speed on taking in what's happening.

"Deary can ya' tell me was' goin' on? Applejack an' Big Mac have gotten smaller!" Granny yells at you, still confused at what is happening.

You quickly think of something to say...
11111212.title: ...confused?

choices: You should take her home to Sweet Apple Acres!
You should revert her back, she'd make a better nanny than a foal.
11113.content:
Now normally to be so hasty as to target someone like Applejack would be shooting yourself in the hoof. She trusts you, she's willing to house you and she's most likely a strong member of the Ponyville community. To use your "device" on her would be biting the hoof before it could feed you. But, well you just can't help yourself!

Everything about her is just too perfect. Applejack is everything you could have wanted in a subject and more, body and mind. That strong, supple body rippling with muscle and capable of cracking open a pony's skull as easily as you would crack open a soggy peanut. And they way she holds her body high suggests both confidence and independence. She is a strong, able-bodied mare. And you can't wait to take it all away from her.

"You feelin' alright sugar cube? Or do you just like starin' at my flank?"

You blush. You must have been staring at her again, time to cover for yourself,

"Oh, don't be silly Applejack. I was just looking at that cart of apples you got there, you sure have a lot to sell today."

Applejack glances at her stack of apples and nods proudly. Apparently that must have been some kind of compliment to her.

"Darn tootin'. Speakin' of which, you want to help me sell 'em? Might take us a while, but it'll give us some time to chew the fat."

You look past Applejack quickly, as to seem casual. The marketplace is still bustling with ponies. It'd be impossible to get Applejack without someone seeing you. And with the nature of your "device", the less ponies that know the better. So you agree to help her hock fruit, if only so you'll have her alone at the end of the day. Applejack sure likes talking, as you soon find out. The hardy mare takes every opportunity she can during your apple selling to "chew the fat", as she so eloquently put it.

"So, I reckon it's none of my business," She said as she passed a small bushel to a customer, "But why leave Manehattan? It seems like a heck of a place to me, bright lights and all. Ponyville must seem like a darn mudhole compared to that magical city."

"You see, Aunt Orange didn't approve of my lifestyles, so I ended up wandering around. That way she'd never know what I was really up to. As far as she knows I'm over at the Trottingham school for developing artists."

Thank goodness lying comes easy to you. Although you're certain you fooled Applejack, you're not sure you like that glint of mischief in her eye.

"Oh really?" She gave you a nudge with her hoof, "Alternate lifestyles eh? Well around here we call that fillyfoolin', Cream. And trust me, nopony is more welcoming a' that than me."

You blush, "A-applejack! I'm your cousin for Celestia's sake!"

That look in her eye just gets more disturbing. You think she's undressing you with her eyes when she says, "Well that certainly didn't stop Big Macintosh from giving the business ta Apple Fritter; makin' her preggers. Heck, he even popped a few shots in mah belly, and we're brother and sister. The apple family has no problem with 'Alternative lifestyles', Ms. Orange Cream."

Holy flying fuck. She's an inbred hick! She's fucking her brother, she's got a nephew whose parents are cousins! She'd fuck anything long enough to rub her snatch, you bet, and the worst part is you couldn't possibly be more aroused. Applejack notices how deeply you're blushing, and she gives you one last unsettling smile before helping out a few ponies who gathered about to grab some apples.

You're so embarrassed that you don't say another word as you sell the remained of your new friend's stock of apples.

...later that day...


"You have a good one Berry Punch. And take it easy on the cider, ya hear?" Applejack gives a friendly wave to the last pony of the day. It's the cusp of the evening, nopony else seems to be around. Which is good since you're fresh out of apples, the two of you.

"Well shoot, I think you're good luck Orange Cream, I never sell a whole cart in an average afternoon."

"I guess I am," You chuckle, "Maybe it's a good thing I showed up."

"More like it's a good thing I caught you stealing apples." Applejack says, and the two of you share a laugh. You're glad you spent this time with her, even if it was a bit awkward. She's such a fun mare be around, must be her natural honesty and outgoing personality. Though it's gonna be a shame you have to use your delightful "device" on her and make all of that go away.

"By the way," You said, reaching into your saddlebags, "I've got a little something I wanted to show you. Now I wasn't so sure youmd like it, but you did make it very clear how much you enjoyed 'Alternate Lifestyles' so I think you're ready for it!"

"Oh shoot!" Applejack glances over her shoulder to make sure no one was watching. She's blushing already and she hasn't even seen it, "Are you telling me you got something naughty in there? I wasn't expectin' to get in yer bridle before dinner!"

Naughty little thing. You'll fix that soon enough.

"Oh, I think you'll really enjoy this Applejack!" You pull the package out of your bag. It's small, no bigger than your head, and wrapped in unassuming brown paper. You give a tug on the string holding it together and the paper falls over, revealing what looks to Applejack like a foal's toy. You know much better than that, though. It's no mere toy, despite looking like a small, stand-alone mobile painted in bright pastel pinks and blues. From it's strings hang small ceramic figures of a rattle, a bottle of milk, and a diaper. While Applejack stares at the device you quietly slip a pill under your tongue and hold it there. You can't actually make the device target one pony alone, so you merely keep the antidote easily accessible.

"Uh, I'm afraid I'm unfamiliar with this little 'Alternate Lifestyle', Cream. You don't suppose you could explain this one to me, can you?"

"Don't worry Applejack darling, just sit back and relax. You won't have to worry about anything anymore..."

You flick a small switch on the base of the mobile and the little device begins to whirr. Calliope music begins to filter out of a small speaker on the bottom, sound very much like a tiny tin carousel. The strings start to spin, each hanging from a different branch and spinning independently from one another. You find yourself compelled to stare just as much as Applejack as the rows of lights lining the base start to strobe and flash different colors. If you were able to pull your eyes away from the beautiful spinning mobile you'd notice Applejack's pupils have dilate and drool has begun to pool in her gaping mouth. You feel your memories start to slip away as you approach the edge. It almost scares you how well the device works. Everything you are and everything you know is drawn out of your mind by the spinning and flashing colors alongside the rapidly accelerating music. And then just as quickly as it started, the device stops. Music screeches to a halt and the lights suddenly go out, leaving two ponies without their minds.

You subconsciously swallow the pill in your mouth, allowing your thoughts to come flooding back to you. Applejack is not so fortunate, the device has left her sitting on the ground without a lick of common sense. Her eyes are wide and free, free of all those troubling thoughts and ideas that filled her head. Sometimes you get jealous of your subjects.

You reach into your saddlebags and retrieve a small bib for her to wear and a hanky to wipe her mouth, which already coated in spittle. She must have been licking her lips.

"Uhh.. Ooha..." She's so far gone that she can't form sentences anymore.

"Aw, poor darling, are you hungry? Do you want some applesauce?" You keep a variety of mashed foal food on you, but you think some plain old applesauce would be better for her.

"Apluu... Appluu..." She seems to remember "apple". That's just adorable!

You break out a jar and do your best to feed her, but little Applejack seems to be a handful! She nearly swallows the spoon while you feed her the sweet mush. In fact you think you're going to have to do something to calm her down. Perhaps....
11113.title: Applesauce for brains

choices: ...into the playpen with her brother and her sister!
...on diaper duty!
111131.content:
Applejack sure is a lively one! You can barely keep her still, with all her kicking and giggling. By the time you're finished feeding her the little cup of cinnamon applesauce, she's managed to completely coat herself in the sticky mush. You think you're going to have to get her home right away so you can get her in a nice comfy bed with a little poofy diaper on her wittle bitty rear.

Actually, you decide to slip one of your crinkly ones on her now just in case she has a little accident on the way over.

"Ready to go baby?" You ask your little bundle of joy, who can only giggle in response. That's the closest you're probably getting to a yes, so you scoop her up onto your back. "Oh my, such a heavy baby you are! We're gonna need something to carry you, aren't we?"

She laughs and kicks her hooves against your belly. Normally that'd hurt, but her muscles are relaxed to the point of uselessness, so it's like being kicked by a little baby. Like the baby she is.

"Wanna ride in the apple cart sweetums?"

"Yah! Yah!"

You smile as you load your big baby into the back of the apple cart and pass her a rattle so she can pass her time by shaking and probably chewing on it. Thankfully, she's not so heavy as to keep you from pulling her all the way to her home. At first you were worried that you wouldn't be able to find Sweet Apple Acres, but then you realize that it's a Celestia-damned farm! You'd have to be nearly blind to miss finding a farm on the edge of this little town. Still, you take your time while you do it, so you can listen to Applejack burble and speak to her while you walk. You even sing her some little songs while you do it, making her laugh and clop her hooves together in messy time to your melodies.

"Oh!" You stop singing just in time to see the farmhouse on the horizon, "Sweetums, is that your home?"

Applejack pulls herself up to look at the familiar home, "Appluu! Appluu haus!"

"Ooooh, Apple house! Is that it?" You ask her in a playful tone.

"Yah! Yah!"

She means the Apple Family house, of course. She definitely remembers her home, that much is clear. As you pull her little wagon up to the front door she starts hopping up and down until she nearly bounces out of the cart.

"Gwammy Smit, Gwammy Smit, Gwammy Smit!" She chants.

You guess "Grammy Smit" must live here with her. You'll have to take a little time to convince the old mare of the joys of adult foals, but you doubt that will be very difficult. Mares in general are much more receptive of seeing their loved ones as little foals again.

You help Applejack off the cart (although she really jumps into your arms without your help) and carry her to the door, just in time for an old green mare to open the door. She's a terribly withered old thing, grey-haired and supported by a walker. She seems to have trouble seeing you, but she still smiles. She must love visitors.

"Hello there dearie," she says, "can ah help you?"

"Gwammy Smit!"

Her tired eyes slowly open with confusion and surprise, "Applejack is that-"

"Hello, I'm Orange Cream. We need to talk."

You let yourself in, depositing your foal onto the couch. Granny Smith seems to have a lot of trouble understanding exactly what's going on, but you're sure that she'll understand in time. They always do. While Applejack kicks and giggles and burbles, Granny Smith looks her over. The grandmother gives her a few pokes her in the belly and makes her shake with gleeful joy.

"What's wrong with her?"

"Oh, nothing's wrong. She's just a baby in her head now, and she'll stay that way."

"Is that all?" She says. You nod, and she nods too, then Granny smith screams, "What!?"

"Don't look so panicked, she's so calm and relaxed now. And don't try to tell me you wouldn't like to keep her a foal for just a little longer."

"I..." Granny Smith doesn't know what to say. She starts to remember the last time she saw Applejack like this was... Years go. She remembered feeding her applesauce and singing camping songs to little baby Applejack while she baked apple pies. She remembers back when her little granddaughter didn't even have a Cutie Mark, when she hardly left the farmhouse. She doesn't stay with her old Granny much anymore, but now she would have to. She would have to rely on Granny Smith again. A little bittersweet tear runs down the tired old mare's eye.

"If you want to change her back," you hold out the bottle of pills to Granny Smith, "all you have to do is give her one of these."

She pushes the bottle away, "Nah.. She's perfect." You were already smiling, but that makes you grin even wider, and then Granny says something that stretches your grin from ear to ear.

"You don't suppose you could do what you did to a big ol' stallion, do ya?"

...


Big Macintosh turned much easier than you thought he would've. The machine worked quickly, sapping the muscular mare of every bit of self-sufficiency and leaving him a two-hundred pound foal that could barely stand on his own. Right now you're standing above them both while they roll about in Apple Bloom's old playpen(which you fetched from the attic at Granny Smith's request). You're jingling a key ring above their heads, making them drool with amazement. In the air is the distinct scent of apples and cinnamon.

"Granny Smith, is the apple cobbler almost ready?" You call to her, "We need to make sure it's cool before the little darlings get hungry!"

Granny calls back, "Just a bit, Orange Dearie! Make sure my babies are happy 'till the grub comes!"

"Can do!"

You're having so much fun with these little, er, big foals that you don't even hear the door swing open until it creaks near the end of its swing. Standing there, wide-eyed, is Apple Bloom, youngest of the Apples. She's looking right at you and she has never been more confused in her whole life. Luckily for her, you've already got a plan for her. Little Apple Bloom is going...
111131.title: Granny again

choices: Apple Bloom steels her nerves and changes the diaper.
Apple Bloom can't manage it, she'll need a different task.
1111312.content:
You considered, for a moment upon seeing her, that you would make Apple Bloom an infant alongside her brother and sister, but two things stopped you from doing so: One, that you were already short on hooves to take care of the two babies you had and couldn't really manage a third, and two was that you didn't particularly enjoy turning someone her age into an infant. And besides, you always enjoyed the irony of the youngest sister suddenly thrust into the responsibility of caring for their "elders".

"Why hello there, Apple Bloom, is it?"

She could only respond by letting her jaw drop in shock at the sight of her two older siblings in a crib, wearing diapers.

"I'm glad you're here, Big Macintosh needs a change!"

Her pupils shrink. She turns toward you, finding your grin sickening. The slam of a door shocks Bloom into turning around to see that Granny Smith had snuck about her and closed her only route away from this situation. Her grandmother gives her an encouraging push forward.

"Go on dearie," Granny Smith says, "your little brother needs his diaper changed. A young mare like yourself has to know these things for when she has a foal."

"Wha- buh, buh, but I, I don't, he doesn't..." Apple Bloom stammers on as her grandmother slowly pushes her toward the playpen where her siblings eagerly await her. You unlatch the door and pull Applejack over to the side so she doesn't get in the way of Apple Bloom changing Mac. Little Applejack is such a hoof-full, you don't think you'd even bother having Apple Bloom try and change her. Mac is a much better place to start.

"Go ahead Apple Bloom," Granny Smith is still being as encouraging as she can to get Apple Bloom to move along. As she enters the playpen, Big Mac laughs a big, dumb laugh, clops his hooves together and falls on his back, presenting his diaper to her. She winces at the fresh scent of it.

"Well," she says, holding her nose, "what am I supposed to do with it?"

You laugh, "Oh Apple Bloom, you're supposed to change it! You know, open it up, pull it off, clean Mac's rear, powder him, put a new diaper on him and toss the old one! Easy as apple pie!"

She shoots you a sideways glance, "How in the hay am I supposed to do that? With my mouth?"

A smile dawns on your face. A smile that does the precise opposite of calming poor Bloom.

"Oh no," she protests, "no no no a hundred times no! There is no way that-"

You decide to cut her off by bonking her on the head with your hoof, "You help, or we throw you out. Besides, it's not so bad. Watch, I'll get you started."

You pop the straps of Big Mac's diaper off with your teeth, eliciting a giggle from the stupefied stallion. The bundle unfurls in front of Apple Bloom, opening up a bouquet of horrid aromas and sights that she never wished to see. She immediately brings a hoof to her mouth to stifle the wave of puke that flies up her throat the instant she was exposed to it.

"Go on Apple Bloom," you cheer, "you can do it!"

Granny Smith gives her a comforting pat on the back, "Yes dearie, go on and change your brother. It's as easy as pie!"

Between your and Granny Smith's encouragement, you manage to reduce the look of horrified disgust on her face to a look of sickened indecision, but will Apple Bloom be able to go through with it?
1111312.title: The Apple of your Eye

choices: You want this southern mare: right. now.
You know what, that hunger is killing you...
111132.content:
You suddenly remembered that this fine (inbred, but still) mare actually offered you a home, and where the hay was that apple acre she talked about anyways? Besides, this 'game' of your would take wuite a while to perform, and it was getting late. Dang, your arousal for dominance had gotten the better of your logical processing.... again. Also, you could just use her in other ways. After all, with strong physics come often a weak mind.

"Oh well, maybe another time..." you say to yourself with a disappointed sigh before putting away the jar of applesauce back where it was hiding in your bag together with the spoon. And as soon as little Applejack hardly had noticed her bib being ripped of, you flip up the same kind of pill you recently swallowed and opens her filthy mouth filled with applesauce. You stagger in disgust for a second but finds the courage to just put the pill on her tongue and close her mouth again with both your hooves.

She struggled in the beginning from the annoying object suddenly trying to slip down her throat, but with a little upward jerk, you hear the relieving sound of a swallow.

Applejack's memory flashed back, causing her eyes to cross for a second before she shook her head violently. "Blurgh! Wha' in tarnation... jus happen'?" she asks with suspicious glances everywhere. "An why the hay do ah taste *smack smack*..... applesauce?" she stated after a little taste.

"I dunno about the taste, but you looked a little shook up, so I decided to stop and let you rest" you answer without any exposure of your secret.
