PFFFTT "ahhh that felt good" pinkie said with a dreamy look on her face

what do you do now?
1221322.title: "I'm very nervous...."

choices: Another pregnant pony,
Big Macintosh
Shocker: It's the father of your foal
1222.content:
"Wait...WHAT???!!!" you half scream aloud in shock.


"Well we checked and rechecked the test results and they all came back the same" She answers trying her best to calm you, "Congrats Miss Orange Cream, you're gonna be a mother."


Your mind scrambles to try and compute the news the nurse pony has just delivered. You..pregnant? How can that be possible? You haven't done with a stallion since..forever, at least it felt like forever since... "Ah heyseed"


The nurse mare looked from the notepad where'd she'd been writing down some notes, "Now now Miss Orange, it's understandable if you're scared. It's normal for first time mothers to feel-"


"No it's not that" You interrupt "It's just that... Well, let's just say that a few months back I was at this party in Hoofington where I met an old coltfriend of mine and..." You trail off as your cheeks flush red with embarrassment.The nurse's expression is blank for a second before realization dawns on her


"Oh my"


You slowing nod to the affirmative, "I've only seen him once or twice since then... ah shit what am I'm gonna do now?!" You add with a sigh and look of dejection.


The nurse reaches out and gently holds your hoof "Well, the important thing right now is taking care of yourself and your foal. If you want I can schedule you in two weeks from now for another check up, till then just remember to take things easy and don't think twice about visiting the clinic if you need anything, okay?"


"Yeah that sounds good for a start" you answer. You feel some what better but the news that you're gonna be a mother is still hard to completely register in your mind.Just how are you gonna care for a child especially when you just arrived in town.You don't even have a place to stay let alone a job.


These thoughts are still dancing around your cranium as you walk out into the waiting room.So absorbed are you in your current predicament that you fail to notice the other pony stepping into the clinic until the two of you ungracefully collide. "Ooof, watch it bub" you exclaim in quick frustration before seeing who other pony is.To your muted surprise it's...
1222.title: ...Have a Bun in The Oven

choices: Feeling hungry, ya'll decide to get a bite to eat
Head shraight to Bonbon house and meet Lyra.
12221.content:
You stop your little rant of irritation just long enough to get a look at just who it is you've bumped into, and immediately stop upon getting a good look at her.


She's an earth pony much like yourself, only being cream colored instead of your coat's light orange.Her mane and tail are both two-toned in color, dark blueish purple and pink.Her light blue eyes seem to sparkle even in the somewhat drab light of the clinic, you couldn't imagine anypony who wouldn't wanna get lost in those shiny pupils of hers.


It isn't long before the most distinguishing characteristic about her comes to your attention though...her frame held a real good deal of girth.Chubby cheeks frame her face along with an extra chin and a few obvious crumbs of food while a soft layer of fat wrap around her pudgy legs and back.


This tubby mare's most prominent feature though is clearly her great jiggly belly, simply put it's enormous.The cream colored globe of pudge bulging out at the sides and down low to the ground, the thickness carrying over to her already ample flanks on which her cutie mark of three blue and yellow wrapped candies are proudly displayed.


So absorbed are you in taking in the stranger's bulk that isn't until she shakes you gently with one of her hooves that you blink out of your pudge induced trance... "Hello there, I said I'm sorry I walked into you" she spoke with a bemused smile.


Snapping out of your trance you turn back to the mare in question.A hundred thoughts and theories are running through your head on just how one pony could get so fat, but you push 'em to back of your mind as you finally speak. "Oh....um yeah, that's alright. It was an accident after all."


With a soft giggle the plump mare nods in agreement "Yeah well glad to see no harm done, walking around with all of this hasn't been easy" she rubs her beach ball of a stomach to emphasize the statement. You try to stifle a giggle at the sight while nodding agreement.Seeing this her smile grows a bit wider as she continues.


"Anyways, I was just in for my monthly check up. Nurse Redheart's really been giving me a case about my weight gain... saying it's may not be good for the foal and what not" she says the last bit with a cheerful little laugh and another rub of her bloated belly.


That last line has you suddenly remembering why you're here in the first place... "Whoa wait, you mean you're..." you ask before she playfully puts her hoof to your mouth to shush you.


"Haha isn't it obvious?" she teases as she waddles over to the receptionists desk to check in "The little big bundle isn't due for another month and a half, til then I just kick back and take it easy" she adds with a gleeful chuckle "Oh and indulge myself with sweets of course... by the way why are you here at the clinic?" she finally asks out of curiosity.


"Heehaa..." you laugh nervously "Well, lets just you aren't the only with a bun in the oven" The redness of your cheeks threatens to stain your face, but your embarrassment soon passes as the plumped up mom-to-be waddles back over and gives you a quick gentle hug.


Her realization is quick "Oh my goodness congratulations that's so great!" her giddiness and joy proving infectious as you can't help but smile as well "Say, after my check up here is done how about us mothers do afterwards to celebrate. We can talk and eat and maybe even have some, how you say, special fun?" she says that last bit with a playful smirk before suddenly realizing something she forgot "Oh wait I don't know your name... speaking of which mine's Bonbon" She shakes your hoof happily.


"I'm Orange Cream, and I just got in from Hoffington actually" you answer "I don't actually have a place to stay and..."


Bonbon interrupts you with another hug "Oh don't worry trouble yourself about that at all, there's plenty of room for a guest at our house we won't mind one bit. Plus it's absolutely free charge."


You're taken aback by this mare's generosity, you barely know each and already she's practically rolling a red carpet for you. "Oh no really that's quite nice of you but I don't want impose... Wait did you say we?"


Giggling again Bonbon gives you a quick answer "Yeah, me and mate Lyra stay right in town..." she stops for a bit upon seeing your face scrunch up with worry before continuing with a smile "Ah don't worry she's nice, though she does have a few eccentric hobbies you'll have to get used too"


You can't help but snicker at that last bit, given that you've have few interesting kinks yourself...but that's best saved for later.


"Heh that sounds like fun.." you answer cheerfully. The tubby mom-to-be beams with glee as she waddles to Nurse Redheart "Excellent then, I'll be right with you when I'm done"


Later after she returns you...
12221.title: Meeting Bonbon

choices: ... you climax, and finish your meal.
...Lyra's Guests arrive!
122211.content:
Around a half-hour later, Bonbon finds you in the waiting room perusing the fashion magazines. Apparently the new "In" of the world of style was plus-sized models. Even Ponyville's own Fluttershy was bulking up for the fall season. The article, photography by Photo Finish of course, praises "Ms. Buttershy's" voluptuous curves. You have to admit she looks good. You glance up from the page and there's Bonbon. Judging from her face she's a little impatient, though not with you.

"Well," Bonbon says, "I don't know about you, but these silly check-ups last just long enough to get my appetite working again. What say us mothers-to-be grab a little something to eat?"

You have to admit, your stomach was definitely grumbling, and it wasn't just the little foal kicking.

"Sure, but you'll have to show me where the good food is!" You say trotting up beside your new friend. Bonbon has a hearty laugh at your suggestion, and says,

"Oh, I can assure you I'm very well acquainted with the best eateries in Ponyville." Bonbon punctuates her thought with a slap on her jiggling belly. You two walk along, each of your bellies bouncing in rhythm with your pace. She leads you to a little roadside stand where a large unicorn sits beside a sizzling griddle. He serves up a pair of veggie burgers to the couple in front of you, and returns to scratching his stubble with the end of his spatula.

"Oh Fry-up," Bonbon waddled right up to the counter, a friendly grin reminded the short order cook of their familiarity, "Fry-up dear, I've got an order for you!"

"Heya Bonnie," Fry-up says, his face lighting up, "The regular then? It'll be a bit, I wish you ordered ahead so you didn't have to wait."

"Sorry to catch you off guard, I hope there's enough patties left!" She chuckles, "My friend and I are eating for two each!"

His eyes fill with joyful surprise, "No foolin', her too? Congratulations miss, ya have my blessing."

"Thank you," You say, "I'll have two doubles and a medium fries, if that's not too much."

The bulky unicorn hugs his own side and laughs, "Too much? I suppose you don't know Bonnie very well, do you?"

"Shush, you grease horse," Bonbon jokes, "You get on, you've got your work cut out for you mister."

And boy did he ever. You watch in awe as the unicorn uses every ounce of magic in him to whip up your meal. Fifteen marinated soy patties levitate over to a piping hot griddle and a spatula darts itself around them, flipping when they're golden brown. Several dozen potatoes are julienne in the air, and fall into a metal basket, which is dunked into sizzling, delicious smelling oil. In the background, a shake machine whirrs, preparing a gallon of strawberry hayshake. Finally, after fifteen agonizing, hunger-filled minutes, five overstuffed, greasy bags are dropped in front of you. Bonbon slaps her payment on the counter, and you two leave with your saddlebags stuffed and your bellies raging for food. But, Bonbon insists on waiting until you get to her house before you can have a bite.

"Aw, come on!" You plead, "Just a bag of fries while we walk?"

Bonbon shakes her head, "Nope, not a nibble till we're home, Lyra would kill me! Besides, we're just around this corner."

She was right, within five minutes you've arrived at her front door. A quaint little two-story cottage, decorated with a neat little wicker design about the edges of the windows and doorframe. Bonbon makes for the door, but you insist that it's the least you can do, considering she's much further along in her motherhood than you. Bonbon walks right into Lyra, a mint colored unicorn, far thinner than her lover, who is waiting for her with a scowl.

"Where were you?" She said, "You know we need to get ready, we're having guests!"

"Oh, but our guest is already here. Orange Cream, meet Lyra, my other half."

"Bonbon!" Lyra is clearly upset, "Who is she?"

The earth pony easies her lover's qualms, "Darling, she's new here. I met her at the clinic and I just had to take her in. She hasn't a home, or job. And she's, well, expecting."

Lyra gasps, "She's..?"

Bonbon nods.

Lyra's eyes go wide, "And the father is..?"

Bonbon nods.

Lyra shakes her head in disbelief, "But then if she...?"

Bonbon nods.

Lyra looks to be on the edge of tears, and wraps her hooves around you without warning, "I'm so very sorry! You couldn't understand how stupid I feel right now Orange, I'm so- ooooh!"

You give her a comforting pat on the shoulder, "Aw come on now, it's not a big deal. I mean, how could I be upset? You've been so kind."

"Yes" Lyra sniffles, "And of course you're still welcome here. We have more than enough accommodations for you."

"Oooh Lyra," Bonbon says, "I have one more surprise."

She drops her saddlebags, and they flip open, exposing the greasy fast food inside. Lyra blushes at the sight, and can't help but open them up to look at the treasure trove inside. It's like a simple veggie burger is something dirty or obscene to her. Bonbon smirks, knowing she's pushing just the right buttons with the unicorn.

"You dirty, dirty girl," Lyra takes one of the burgers and unwraps it, sniffing the alluring aroma, "You filthy thing."

Bonbon says nothing, just opens her mouth and lets her tongue hang out, she gestures a hoof toward her gullet, and Lyra loses it. She leaps onto her beloved Bonbon and pins her to the ground, stuffing the burger into the open mouth. She's sweating, like she's uncomfortably aroused. Lyra pants,

"Right in front of our guest? You filthy whore!" she rolls off of her, grabbing more of the fast food from the bag, she uses her hooves to smear the patties and all their sauce onto her chest, "C'mon you pig, you swollen cow, eat!"

You can't believe you're seeing this. This must be those kinks that Bonbon was talking about earlier, they have a vicious feeder/fed relationship. You get closer, just to see Bonbon nibble and suck those bits of burger off her partner, running her tongue up and down Lyra's saucy(literally!) body. Lyra grabs a crushed patty and half of a hayshake and mushes it into her legs, shiver a bit at the chill. Bonbon dives right in, getting her meal and eating out at once.

You'd never imagine fast food could be this erotic, you're actually getting wet. Lyra notices you, and stuffs a hooffull of fries into her mouth, giving you her best "Come hither" look. You lean down and wrap your lips around the bundle of fries. Lyra leans up, pushing the food into your mouth and her lips onto yours. Her tongue shoves through the fries and into your mouth, pushing mashed potatoes and saliva into your throat.

You break away, but only because you need to chew that bite before you could continue. Lyra takes the time to sprinkle some fries below her tail, getting Bonbon to start slurping at her tailhole. You share a laugh, and in just a bit you're on Bonbon's doorstep. She coyly rings her own doorbell, just so her darling Lyra can open the door for you. She never actually mentioned what her lover looks like, so it's a bit of a pleasant surprise to meet her. Lyra's a mint green unicorn, slender, especially when you see her standing beside her much portlier wife Bonbon.

"It's a pleasure to meet you, Orange," Lyra says, "I'm so glad I had time to redo the guest room, you're going to love it here."

You exchange a quick hoofshake, before Bonbon pushes herself between you two and says, "I'd love to chat, but I'd prefer to do it over a steaming hot dish of your shepherd's pie, Lee."

Lyra smiles, and leads you through the kitchen, to the dining room, where you can see Lyra has already set a place for you around a dish of hot veggies, steamed and drenched in gravy, then covered in hot mashed potatoes. You can't believe they'd be so hospitable to a pony they just met. The three of you take a seat, and Lyra serves Bonbon first, a very hearty helping.

You place a modest portion on your plate, "Oh, no, I don't really have a place to go. I travel a bit and well the father, I didn't expect this so, we didn't... Keep in touch."

"Awful, I'm glad we could help." Lyra says, serving herself last, "Right darling?"

1223122.content:
*poke poke*

"Helloooooo?" you hear somepony call through the haze.

"Be gentle!" another, more familiar voice insists. "She's been through a lot these past few hours."

*poke poke*

Your eyes flutter open as you slowly come to, your vision slowly adjusting to the bright room. "Hmmm, whuu?" you mutter unintelligibly. As you slowly turn your head you catch sight of Nurse Redheart standing in the doorway, looking at you almost fearfully.

"What happened?" you ask weakly.

"Oh! You're awake!" a chipper voice calls from beside you. You turn your head to see a rich purple unicorn standing by your bed, her violet eyes shining as she smiles at you brightly. "We were worried that that little transformation might have left you brain dead or something." she says sounding a little embarrassed.

"T-Transformation?" you mumble.

"Shhhh" she says, putting a hoof over your mouth. "Just relax. I'll try to explain." She clears her throat, straightening out her pink-streaked indigo mane. "My name is Twilight Sparkle. I'm the personal student of Princess Celestia. Your name is Orange Cream, right?"

You nod slowly as she continues. "Well, Miss Cream, it seems you've gone through a sort of... metamorphosis just now."

You look at her. "Meta-..." you trail off. "The wings?"

Twilight points at your face. "And the horn."

Horn? you weakly bring a hoof up to your face. Indeed, there is now a large, spiraled horn jutting out of your forehead. A rather impressively sized one too. A fair bit bigger than Miss Twilight's anyway.

Twilight shrugs a little. "Also... your body mane and tail." she says with a chuckle.

You look at the far end of the room and see Nurse Redheart bringing in a mirror, still looking at you nervously, as if you might strike her down or something. Indeed. Your body seems to have grown considerably. You're several inches larger than the biggest stallion you've ever met. You estimate you're an inch or two taller than Princess Luna. Also your mane and tail are blowing in some nonexistent breeze, and they look to be charged with some sort of energy or something given the glow they're giving off. Your hair ripples through at least three different colors now too. Your usual lilac, a deep navy blue, and a darker purple, similar to the one in Twilight's coat. There's no real order to them, though, like in Luna or Celestia's hair, your mane just seems to surge and ripple and wave with these colors, blending and mixing and flowing.

You turn to the purple unicorn next to you, astounded. "H-How did th-this happen?" you manage to stutter out.

"Well, to be honest, I have absolutely no idea." Twilight shrugs, sounding embarrassed, perhaps even a bit annoyed at her lack of knowledge. "This sort of event... quite frankly it's completely unprecedented. There's no information on anything like this ever having happened before." She perks up as she continues explaining. "However, when Nurse Redheart came to me for advice, I immediately had Spike fire off a letter to Princess Celestia about a 'new Alicorn' right here in Ponyville, so I would be surprised if she isn't on her way here right now to clear things up!"

You nod at her, staring once again at your new reflection. This is all so foreign... but you can't deny that something about it feels really good. Like you could take on the world with all this newfound power. And you have to admit, you do look... beautiful now. You were kinda pudgy and a little stocky before but now you're slender and shapely, your multicolored mane complimenting your shimmering coat, your eyes glowing, even in the light of the room.

As you're staring at yourself you suddenly...
1223122.title: A Brand New You

12231221.content:
There she is, standing there in the doorway. The graceful, slender princess of Equestria, Celestia. Right now you're one of the only ponies in the world who can stand at eye-level with her, and you must admit the view from up here is stunning. As she strides forward, with a gracious grin plastered across her face, you can't help but feel a little weak in the knees. She's practically melting you with her eyes, her deep, lucious, soul-filling, glimmering, -

"Greetings, Cream." Celestia politely breaks you out of your trance.

"G-greetings Princess!"

"Twilight," she turns to her student, "I am very happy that you brought this new friend to my attention, but I wish to be alone with her as we have much to discuss."

Twilight nods, seeming to understand precisely what the princess is saying with that vague little statement, and takes your hoof to shake it in a parting gesture before leaving alongside the nurse. Celestia waits patiently for the door to close completely before turning to you. It's quite odd, what happens next, because not a muscle moves on the princess's face and yet you feel her emotions shift. Not more than a minute ago she gave off a quiet warmth that wordlessly expressed her interest in you, but now she clearly radiates an intense delight. She's quite happy to be around you.

"Orange," she starts walking around you, "I'm sure you realize that we're quite unique ponies. It's been millenia since I've seen another Alicorn, especially one as... Delightful to the eye, as you."

"Oh my goodness," you whisper. You simply have to look your slim face away to keep her from seeing how deeply you're blushing.

"Mmn, yes, you're a very pretty pony. And a very powerful pony, aren't you?"

"I... I.."

Before you can get past that lump in your throat, Celestia pounces on you and drags her tongue across the length of your horn. With a broken squeal, you lurch back and fire a gooey blast of magic at the ceiling that sticks fast and glows with natural energy. That feeling of release felt like the greatest orgasm you've ever had

"Sweet Celestia..."

"Yes?" your princess giggles, stepping off of you, "Now you see? You're far too special to be around the common pony. That's why I'm here. My sister and I understand how an Alicorn should live. Of course, you would have responsibility as a pony above ponies. But that will come in time."

"Princess Celestia, how could I-"

She places a hoof over your mouth and smiles, "You don't have to decide just yet. In fact, I'd much prefer if we did a few things first. Like... This."

Celestia turns her head upwards and fires a prismatic burst of energy at the ceiling. As the light impacts, it fades the roof about you away, as if it were never there. Her wings spread, scattering pure white feathers around you.

"Come fly with me," she says, before thrusting her great white wings at the ground and rising with the gust into the air. Normally you'd hesitate, but the sight of the bright blue sky above you is too much to resist, and you thrust yourself up after her, feeling the air rushing past as you climb up beside her. At first she's much quicker than you, turning much easier and faster than you can, but as you chase her across the clouds you begin to catch her rhythm. Soon, you're right beside her, laughing and twirling like a leaf on the wind.

"Hey," you finally call out over the wind, "where are we going?"

Celestia doesn't answer, instead letting another beam arc from her horn, directing you towards...

122312211.content:
You bank sharply, turning to follow celestia as the two of you speed towards the mountains. As if on cue, a dark-blue streak flies up alongiside- princess Luna has joined you. Celestia smiles at her sister as the three of you power your way towards the mountain range.

After a solid hour of flying, your wings are shot and you are dizzy and light-headed. You land clumsily on a flat projection of rock jutting from the side of the mountain that appears to be your destination. Celestia helps you to your feet, and Luna offers you an apple to regain your strength. You gladly accept it and swallow it whole.

After you've had a small rest, the sun princess motions for you to follow her. The plateu on which you stand is home to a small cave, a gaping black maw yawning from the rock face. You follow the princesses somewhat nervously.

Inside, Luna casts a spell for light. You gasp loudly.

The cave is essentially a gigantic geode. The walls are made of smoothly polished crystal, and they glimmer enticingly from the glow of the spell. You prod one experimentally- it shocks you. They're also humming with magic, apparently.

"Welcome to equestria's greatest secret," Celestia says with a smile, "The hall of attainment. This is where alicorns come to be baptized in the power that makes us what we are." She hums a single note, pure and clear, and it reverberates throught the tunnel.

You trot down, the hummed note still bouncing about, and finally stop at the semicircular end to the cave. It splits off into two paths. you look up- above each, carved from the crystal of the cave itself, are two statuettes, the iconography such that you can't make head or tail of it's meaning. The two princesses stand beside you solemnly, before each turning to face one of the two tunnels. Both their horns glow, and twin beams of light glow, shooting down the length of both tunels before striking an orb carved at the end of each.

The light diffuses though both tunnels, illuminating them. The princesses turn to you.

"Now it is time to choose," they sing in unison. You shrink back- their eyes are white, shrouded in caster's glow.

"The path of the Elements beckons you." Celestia states. The carving above her tunnel glows brightly, the image of the sun superimposed upon it.
"The path of the Forces beckons you." Luna sings out a second later. Her carving glows as well, an image of the moon blossoming to life.

"Neither path will think less of you if you decline." They say in unison again. That's actually extremely creepy.

The two princesses stand expectantly. It's time to decide.

You gulp. "I choose..."

She looks at you. "Knowing this, are you sure you wish to walk the path of the Forces?"

You open your mouth, and tell her:

122312211211.title: Life and Death!

choices: You'd rather be with a stallion.
Well, she is attractive.
1223122112112.content:
Almost without even thinking about it, you touch the pony skull relief. You see your hoof moving for it, yet somehow it doesn't even register that you're making this decision, it just doesn't feel like you're in control of your own actions at this moment. You feel disconnected from your own body, and about all you can think is about you not being in control and your body not doing anything you were trying to tell it to do. At least, it feels this way as long as you have your hoof outstretched, but the moment you retract it, before you can begin to panic, you feel... different, like you're in control of your body again. You put your hoof back on the ground, but you don't feel the contact and think nothing of it. Instead, all you can think about is what you were expecting when you decided which power to choose, what you would have to face once you made that decision, and instead, all you got was a feeling of being outside your own body and watching as you touched a stone carving of a pony's skull with a buzzard perched on it. Whatever you were expecting, none of it happened and you can't help but feel underwhelmed. "So much for subjugating or coercing these powers," you say to yourself as you turn from the bust. "What's going on? Could they be wrong? Is this some kind of joke?" Rather than staying put and trying to figure this out on your own, you decide to head back down the corridor and ask Princess Luna what's going on. She knows more about all of this than you do, so maybe she knows why it didn't work.

You make your way from the chamber down the short corridor toward where you left the Princess, but something seems odd to you. Specifically, the crystals surrounding you don't seem to be sparkling as brightly as they were before. This comes across as strange to you, but you have other matters to attend to, namely figuring out why your attempt to harness one of these powers ended in failure. You approach the intersection of the two paths, and it is brighter than the corridor you just exited, but still doesn't seem to be lit by the Princess'. "Princess," you say as you exit the corridor and approach the mare standing right where you left her, "I think something's wrong. I touched a bust and nothing happened. I mean, something happened, it felt like I was outside my own body, watching as I reached out for the bust, and when I pulled my hoof back, I felt in control of my body again, but no different. Whatever I was supposed to face, it didn't happen." The dark blue alicorn doesn't answer you, instead staring straight ahead down the path you both headed down to get here, her eyes still that freaky white indicating she's still concentrating on her spell. "Princess?" You put your hoof on her shoulder, but she doesn't respond. "Princess Luna, please. I need help." Again, the younger of the Royal Pony Sisters doesn't budge. A thought enters your mind, that this is part of the test and whatever you're supposed to face, she is not supposed to help you in any way. If that's true, however, wouldn't it be more obvious you were supposed to go somewhere or what you were supposed to do? "Whatever," you say as you turn from the unhelpful mare after a while of trying to coerce her into telling you what's going on. "Death didn't work, so I'm going to try Time."

You approach the Time bust, and it gives no indication you touched it. You try, again and again, to get it to acknowledge you and begin the test, but nothing happens. You try all four busts, Time and Space, Life and Death, and none respond to yout touch. At this point, you're beginning to feel frustrated and more than a little let down. All that pain in your back when the wings sprouted, and your head felt like your skull was breaking when your horn sprouted, all of that, for nothing? No power? No special talent beyond what you're already good at? And to make it worse, the Princess isn't even allowed to respond if you come with a question. "Just great," you mutter to yourself as you touch the Space bust, which also gives no response. You head out of the chamber and back toward the Chamber of Life and Death. You storm down the corridor and march right up to the tree relief that was the Life bust and strike it, but it too gives no response. You turn on the Death bust. "Buck you, Death. I don't know what power you might have bestowed on me when I won, but you can forget it now. I'm going to walk the Path of Elements, I'm going to harness the power of Earth, and I'm going home!" Princess Luna was ignoring you, the busts weren't responding anymore. You're beyond frustrated after numerous attempts, you're furious.

Your anger, great as it is, begins to abate as you head down the corridor you originally came from. It seems to you that what you need is to take a walk, and so far, doing just that is working wonders. The further you distance yourself from the Chambers of Life and Death and Time and Space, the more accepting of the fact that it was you who made the mistake you become. So you won't look the same after choosing an Element rather than a Force. It beats having the power to ease the pain of the suffering as they die, or whatever the power of Death would allow you to do had you been meant to wield it. It was an honest mistake. Surely Princess Celestia will open the path and let you try the other powers.

You walk the corridor in silence except for your thoughts, and the further you go, the less important those thoughts seem to you. The only thing that seems to matter to you before long is getting to the end of this corridor so you can move on, so you can leave everything that's already happened behind you and get on with the next step. What's passed is past, you feel, and with each step down this corridor, which suddenly seems a great deal longer than it originally was, certain thoughts become important again, like your life before this point, and how things would have been had you made other decisions than those you did. The ponies you've met, and those you've yet to meet, and even those you never will, all of them come to mind, as do all the things you could do with them, and as you think about that, you feel sad for some reason, as though before now, there just wasn't enough time for it all, and now that you're making a monumental change in your life, there will be even less time for those kinds of things. This weighs heavily on your heart, and without warning, you begin to cry. For all the ponies you'll go without seeing for long periods of time and those you'll never see again. For everything you never had the chance to do and now never will. It just seems so unfair, and yet, all you want to do, this entire time, all that matters is leaving this place as soon as possible.

Eventually, you do in fact come to the end of the long corridor, and the room you enter is not the one you and Princess Luna left Princess Celestia in. No, this room is big, and it's bright. There are no crystals here, and everything looks gray as far as you can see, and yet it still seems like the sun is shining. You trot around, looking for a way out besides the way you came, while thinking in the back of your mind about what you went through in the cooridors of the Path of Force and exactly what happened that you would enter a room like this. Did you turn somewhere? Ascend or descend stairs and didn't notice? As you ponder this, you continue to look for another exit. Before you can take another step, however, pain suddenly wracks your entire body, and you collapse. As you writhe in agony, images flash in your head. Images of ponies, sad and grieving, and the more images you see, it becomes clear that what you're seeing isn't jut sad ponies, griving over some loss, these are ponies grieving over losses close to them, and with that you realize that given the angle you're seeing these from, you're not just witnessing loss, you're witnessing the last moments of ponies from all over the world and feeling everything they felt in the moments before they died. This continues for what seems an eternity, and eventually you see one final image, this one feeling closer to you than any other. A pony moves from a grave, and you can see the stone, flowers on it. Flowers that you like. You've never seen the pony by the grave, but they still look familiar somehow. You seem to be in control of this image, completely unaware that the pain is long gone, instead more immersed in what you're seeing in your mind. You study the face of the pony for a while, and when no name comes, you intead turn to the tombstone and read it. A feeling of dread overcomes you, and with it, all the emotions you felt before now come rushing back and taking hold tenfold. The confusion about the disconnection, the rage at being ignored, the sorrow of realizing you'll never see those you know and love again. The name on the tombstone is your name, and tears fall freely from your eyes as the realization hits that this image in your head is a glimpse of the future, of your your future. Of your grave.

You cry for some time as you realize what you've just been through, and soon, you get the feeling you're not alone. You look up to see a mare, roughly half your height and coat the color of the light of the full moon, is in the room with you. Where she came from and when she arrived, you don't know, but here she is, and you are relieved to see somepony at last. Before you can speak to her, more images enter your mind, and you get the feeling from them that this mare is your test and these images in your mind are her method of communication. It seems you'll have to please her if you hope to gain her power, the images being those of ponies engaged in sexual activity followed by her merging with you. She shows you the image of your future grave again as a warning of what will happen if you do poorly.
1223122112112.title: What Happens To Us All?

The more she thrusts the icier it becomes, until you're certain that your slightly lubricated walls are going to freeze fast to her frigid cock. You start to wonder about the fact, when those hooves holding your mouth suddenly creep lower, to your throat, and wrap tight. Celestia no, she's choking you out!

You struggle to pull your head up, but only manage to get high enough off the ground to look Death in her dominating eyes. That's when you get a good look at the bones wrapped around her neck as well. She's choking herself too! Can Death... does Death even breathe?

Things start to go fuzzy; it feels like you're underwater and you can hear the sound of every thrust deep within your brain as the last of your breath slips from your lungs. A cold chill spreads from your loins, one that you're certain is emanating from the otherworldly cock buried deep inside of you. You feel death overtaking you and then... then... An ear-shattering squeal and a flush of heat that ebbs out the cold. Death has just climaxed inside of you. The bony hooves release their grip on your throat while staying close to you. Close enough to lash out and snare you should they try again.

12231221121121.title: Fucking with Death
