...to the scent of fresh death!
122312211211211.content:
The bones all around you wither and crack, then turn to dust. Death pulls her appendage from you, smiling a... warm smile at you. A warm anything was the last thing you thought you'd get from her, let alone a warm smile, but there it is! The ground beneath you warms, your body begins to gain heat and light. Death leans close against you, so that her body begins to sink inside of yours. She's becoming yours, she's becoming your element! It's happening!

In a burst of glowing darkness and burning cold, you are flung from where you combated death and you find yourself laying down, in complete darkness. You try to move your head, but you're too tightly compacted to even struggle. You begin to become frustrated, channeling magic as you kick and flail inside of your... tomb? Oh gosh! You've been buried alive, you're sure of it! You kick harder, firing magic as you do, until you start to feel your coffin crack. Yes! You've got it, you just need more power.

You channel harder, stronger, until, in a burst of triumphant energy, you leap upwards, sending dirt and splintered wood scattering through the night's sky. You drift back to the earth, looking over the area around you as you do. It's a simple graveyard, one that you're not familiar with. In front of the hole you just made is an ornate marble marker labeled, "Here lies Princess Creamsicle. Death forevermore."

You're starting to think that isn't a typo.

You think that you should return to Celestia and Luna, but you're not sure where you would go to meet them, given that you've never been to this neck of the woods. That, and you hardly seem to care about Celestia or Luna anymore. Instead, the entirety of you is focused in on something else. A thick, sweet smell in the air, close. Your eyes snap open, you hone in on the smell. On withered wings you jet into the air and feel yourself melding into the darkness. You are now an angel of death, and you feel your prey coming close. Someone is near death.

You wing above the clouds, coming to a village far below. It's not Ponyville. It's not anywhere you've been before. But, still someone is nearing death. You're rapidly drawn to the scent, flying towards and then through a small hut. In it, you find a somber scene: an older stallion is laid out on a bed, wheezing his last breath, while another old pony, most likely his wife, holds his hoof. Invisible to them both, you creep close to the bed and lay on top of the stallion. Your added weight pushes the breath from him, which you quickly inhale. His wife gasps, certain he's not long for this world.

Your intangible body slips between the thin blanket that he's laid under, so that you can rub your body against his. He starts to sweat, he feels his cock slip from its sheathe but he's too weak to struggle. This is probably the first erection he's had in decades. You slip his cock inside of you, the heat and moisture makes certain that he's brought to a very speedy orgasm. One that, along with seed, flushes out the last of his life. His soul exits his body in pure bliss.

Is this how you're supposed to do it? Meh, you're improvising a new strategy. Leaving his widow to grieve, to ascend into the night and head...
122312211211211.title: I am become death!

choices: You've got questions, Necrose has answers.
1223122112112111.content:
That smell, the to you sweet smell of death, is all around you, coming from everywhere and nowhere, and you know that more ponies lay dying tonight than just the old stallion whose suffering you ended moments ago. You would go to them all if you could, but you don't even know where you are, let alone who you would grant the mercy of death to first once you'd gotten to where ever it is you went after here. After darting around aimlessly one direction then another but going nowhere besides back to the site of your grave, you decide it best to head to Canterlot to talk to Princesses Celestia and Luna, to learn from them, if they know anything about it at all, what it means to be the Equestrian Princess of Death. But your problem persists: you don't know where you are, and the smell of death is the most wonderful thing you've ever smelled, it's driving you crazy trying to decide what you should do. After much deliberation, you decide it best to go back into the village you visited before and see if there is anypony awake at this hour and ask them where you are and if they could point you in the direction of Canterlot. As much as you want to visit all of the dying ponies in Equestria right now, you need to know what powers and responsibilities you have as the Princess of Death, so you take to the skies once more and fly back to the village, keeping your gaze down-turned, looking for any sign of life at this hour.

From the sky, you get a good look at the village in its entirety. It's not a particularly big village, you can see it all from your vantage point without so much as turning your eyes one direction or another, and you become dispirited when you see that the only lights on are at the hut you had visited previously. Surely there must be somepony else awake who could help you. You fly lower, hoping to see somepony, and after a while, you see a door open and a lit lantern exit from it. You can't see the pony carrying the lantern, so you hover in place to watch them and see where they go. Almost immediately, it becomes apparent that whoever this lone pony is, they are heading toward the cemetery that you rose from. You follow after them, flying slow enough not to outpace them should it turn out they are not heading to the cemetery, but their path is true and you are surprised when they begin heading straight for your grave. Deciding this was all you needed to see, you move ahead of the ground-bound pony and land just in front of the hole in the ground that you rose from a short while before. The pony stops and sets the lantern down in front of themself. In the light, you can see it is an earth pony stallion, almost as tall as yourself and pitch black of coat and gray of mane and tail. He looks at you with emerald eyes, studying your withered and desiccated form, taking in your appearance with a blank expression. If he is alarmed by your appearance, he gives no outward sign, instead bowing before you after several moments of silence and saying, "I greet you, Princess Creamsicle. I am Necrose, the undertaker. I was tasked by Princess Celestia with digging you up from your grave the moment your new life began and bringing you to Canterlot when you felt you were ready for your coronation. Though it seems either I am late or you are waking up early. I do apologize." He returns his gaze to you and stands waiting for you to speak. You open your mouth to speak, and for a moment you are surprised at the sound of your own voice. It is surprisingly soft for a pony whose form is so harsh and unpleasant, and a drastic departure from how you remember sounding before. It takes you only a moment to get over your shock, speaking to the stallion, "I thank you, Necrose. I was hoping I would meet somepony tonight. I wish to go to Canterlot as soon as I am able, I have many questions for Princess Celestia and Princess Luna and I would like to ask them sooner rather than later." The stallion nods and tells you that the hour is late, that while he understands your desire to go to Canterlot, there are no trains running there now, so you have to wait until after Princess Celestia raised the sun to be on your way. You ask him why you would be taking a train to Canterlot and he replies that Princess Celestia ordered a train be sent to a nearby town for you to board, certain that you would not know where you were when you rose from your grave, so felt it best you not try to fly to Canterlot, lest you get yourself hopelessly lost. Hearing this, you are reminded that you do in fact not know where you are and promptly ask. "You are outside Tramplevania, Princess," Necrose says, his expression not changing, "Birthplace of the first Princess of Death and traditional burial place of Princesses of Death who fall victim to their own power." The first Princess of Death? Burial place of Princesses of Death who fall victim to their own power? You must be expressing some concern or confusion over this statement, as before you can even ask, Necrose says, "I'm sure you have more questions, Princess, but it is late and we must be to Tramplevania early to make your train. Whatever questions you have that I can answer, I will answer to the best of my ability when we are on the train. I do apologize, but even the Princess of Death needs her rest, so if it please you, I ask that you come with me back to the village inn, where you might rest before you need to be awake." For a moment, you consider punishing him for talking back to a Princess, but you do feel tired after expending so much magic to escape your grave, so agree to go back to the village without protest.

In the morning, Necrose pays the innkeeper for the rooms and the two of you head out for the town he referred to as Tramplevania. You don't recall ever hearing of a town with that name before, and once again, as if reading your mind, the stallion says before you can ask, "We are still in Equestria, Princess. Tramplevania is the furthest east town in Equestria. Further east from there lies a nearly unclimbable mountain range that marks our easternmost border. From there, it is a two-day journey by train west to Canterlot." The two of you continue your walk toward the bigger town in silence except for your hooffalls on the ground. When you get there, the undertaker makes his way toward the train station and you follow, taking in the sights of Tramplevania that catch your eye as you pass. The town reminds you of Ponyville and you can't help but notice the ponies bow before you as you pass. Do they already know that you are the Princess of Death? You look to Necrose for an answer, but he says nothing more until he reaches the ticket counter and introduces you to the pony there as Princess Creamsicle and explains to them Princess Celestia's orders that the two of you and the contingent of guards already on board be the only ponies in the car of the train that the two of you will be riding to Canterlot in. The mare nods when the undertaker finishes speaking, telling him that they have heard the same from Canterlot and are simply waiting for the two of you to board, the rest of the ponies heading there having already boarded. She gives him two tickets and soon, the two of you are on the train and on your way to Equestria's capitol city.
1223122112112111.title: Homeward Bound

choices: Press the issue.
Let it pass, you have too many other questions.
12231221121121111.content:
The Royal Guard is on the train, waiting for you, and apparently Necrose, as well, as when you both board, they snap to attention, as though awaiting orders. You are uncertain of whether you should say anything, but the stallion you're traveling with seems to have an iron grasp on the situation at hoof and without a word, but a nod to one guard standing by the door to the next car, goes through the door when the guard opens it, then turns and motions for you to follow. In the next car, you see only two other guards, these wearing armor that closely matches your own coat color. Seeing them, you can't help but ask the undertaker, "Are these my guards?" He nods. "Yes, Princess," he says as he approaches them, "Two of them, anyway. You'll meet more of them when we get to Canterlot. The guards in the car we boarded the train on protect the entire royal family. These stallions, the Death Guard, are your personal guard. They will obey no orders beyond what you or somepony you authorize to speak on your behalf will issue to them." The guards give no indication whether or not what Necrose said is true, but one says, "Princess, Sir Necrose." as he opens another door, revealing the compartment you and Necrose will be riding in for as much of your trip as either of you care to spend in it. This time, the tall stallion motions for you to enter ahead of him. "After you, Princess," he says.

The door closes behind Necrose as you sit down, and you waste no time in asking him questions. He sssaid he'd answer what questions he could, and you have many. What happened after you touched the bust and passed the trial? Why were you buried alive? How long were you in the ground before you woke up and escaped? These things and questions about being a Princess are foremost in your mind, but the first question you ask is something else entirely. "My tombstone read 'Princess Creamsicle' and you introduced me as such to the mare at the ticket window at the train station, but my name wasn't..." You stop. Wasn't? "Is not," you correct yourself, your tone stern, "Creamsicle, it's Orange Cream." The stallion nods as he sits down across from you. "Yes, about that," he says, rubbing a hoof across the back of his neck and tilting his head back, probably working out some tension or stiffness. "Princess Celestia sends her apologies about that. You see, there was no time to ask you about it. The record obtained from the hospital in Ponyville stated your name as Orange Cream, certainly, but whatever it was you did to discover your true power, you died and there needed to be a name on the tombstone. And therein came a problem. It came to light that you were meant to be a Princess of Equestria all along. I don't know how you were born an earth pony when you were meant to be an alicorn or how they found any of this out, nor do I know why your name was such an issue, but in order for the change to be completed, you needed to be buried after a proper funeral. I don't know how it works, to be honest. All I was told is that the symbol of your power, your grave, needed your name and Princess Celestia decided that since you couldn't be asked, a different name was in order, as you were now the pony you were meant to be all along."

Hearing this, you are stunned. You DIED?! But you passed the test! You saw and felt Death become a part of you. You were alive when that happened! You are quick to protest, telling Necrose about the Path of Forces and your trial, being sure to leave out the part where Death all but raped you, and he simply puts up a hoof to try to stop you and says, "Princess, please. I don't doubt what you say is true, but facts are facts. As the Princess of Death, you are, at least symbolically, not among the living. Again, I don't know what challenges you faced or what changes, physical or otherwise, they mave have begun in you once you'd passed, and I do know that while yes, you are alive, in order for you to become the Princess you were born to be, you old life had to end so your new life could begin. And don't worry, whatever your trial may or may not have entailed, you were not in the ground long. You were buried two days after your trial was deemed a success, and you rose from your grave the Princess you were meant to be three nights later. Everypony in Equestria was informed of these events as they happened, so all know that you are now the Princess of Death and will treat you with as much respect as they would Princess Celestia or Princess Luna." You lean back in your seat and look out the window, watching as Tramplevania moved away and empty wilderness took it's place. This was not what you were expecting to hear. "So. . . I'm undead?" It's all you can ask right now. Necrose shakes his head. "Not exactly," he begins. "You see, when she tasked me with bringing you to Canterlot, Princess Celestia told me a fews thing she felt you would need to know as soon as possible, and gave her consent for me to have access to a restricted section of the royal library, that I might be able to help you learn what you need to know about being the Princess of Death should you wish to know before arriving in Canterlot. There, I learned some things about the Princess of Death, including that she and her sister, the Princess of Life, are both for all intents and purposes alive as any other pony. You still need to eat and sleep, and anything that would end the life of a normal pony such as myself could potentially end yours and your sister's, as well. As to the part where you died and woke up a new pony, all I can do is guess, and my guess would be that your dying set the process in motion, while your funeral was a ritual of sorts to help the changes complete and take hold. I think you're better off talking to Princess Celestia or Princess Luna about this, though."

You eye the undertaker. You're still alive, that's wonderful to hear. But he mentioned the Princess of Death has a sister in the Princess of Life. You don't have a sister, you were an only foal. Right? You mention this to Necrose and he nods more. He explains that even if you were born the only foal to your parents, the moment you realized your destiny, another mare awoke to achieve her true destiny as the Princess of Life after you chose to be the Princess of Death. "I learned that becoming who and what you are now is not the only change that took place. You decided you would wield the powers of Death, and in so doing, bound yourself to the mare who would become the Princess of Life as her sister, as Princess Celestia and Princess Luna are sisters born to the same parents. Another thing I have no answers for, but I do believe the choice was entirely yours to make, so whatever you decided, the other mare, whoever she is, would have become the opposite of what you chose regardless. And I also believe that even if you do not know each other now, you will know each other when you see each other." You run a hoof down your face. This is a lot to take in, but you still have more questions. "So I chose my destiny and that of a mare I don't know, but will know that she is my blood relative when I see her, even though we were born to two different sets of parents, and not only that, but we are also Princesses of Equestria now. If you'd told me this a week ago, I'd have called you a crazy pony." Necrose laughs. "So, what are my powers and responsibilities as the Princess of Death?"

Necrose exhales slowly. "Now this I would have lost no sleep over not answering. It's not that I don't know, I certainly have learned about your responsibilities as the Princess of Death. I just would have preferred to let Princess Celestia answer this one is all." You arch an eyebrow at his response. "Your powers, I know not, but your responsibilities I do. As the Princess of Death, your role in the lives of ponies is their deaths, of course. You are to ease the suffering of the dying by ending their lives at the moment they are supposed to pass. Your task, whether you come to enjoy it or despise it, is nevertheless a vital one, as is that of your sister, as without you, dying ponies would suffer far longer than they should before passing on. In essence, you are to make sure ponies who are about to die don't suffer while your sister ensures the lives of ponies who are not meant to die quite yet. In my research, I recovered nothing about the manner in which you perform your duty, so I assume it has to do with the dying pony. I apologize, Princess, but that is about all I am willing to say on this particular subject. If you wish to know any more, you will have to ask Princess Celestia."

Necrose is behaving strangely, you can tell. You could force him to talk. You are a Princess, after all. Killing him or injuring him would probably be a bad idea, as he has more information to help you make sense of all that's happened and will happen, and dead, he can't talk, and injured, he might refuse to, but if there's something he could tell you about being the Princess of Death so you had fewer questions for Princess Celestia, you would like to know it. You mull it over and decide to...
12231221121121111.title: You've got questions, Necrose has answers.

choices: Suddenly, the train stops.
The day passes, and in the morning...
122312211211211112.content:
Whatever Necrose may know about your powers and responsibilities to the ponies of Equestria, it may be for the best if Princess Celestia answered that question. It was she and Princess Luna who took you to the cavern complex where you completed the trial and earned your powers, so if anypony would know and be able to tell you what you need to kow, it would be one of them. You tell the earth pony you have other questions and he thanks you, telling you to ask whatever other quetions you may have. You begin by asking about Tramplevaia. "You said last night that Tramplevania is the birthplace of the first Princess of Death and the traditional burial place of Princesses of Death who fall victim to their their own power. Wh-what do you mean by that?" Your voice wavers and you can't control it. As much as you want to know what is apparently now your own history, you also fear more than anything your own demise, now more than ever after your experience during the trial, and dying once to realize your true destiny did nothing to abate that fear. The stallion begins by telling you that as Princesses Celestia and Luna were born as any other pony ever to live, so too were the Princesses of Life and Death. "The Princess of Life and the Princess of Death have always been sisters as the Princesses of the Sun and Moon, but unlike Princess Celestia and Princess Luna," the undertaker continues, turning his gaze from you to some unknown thing outside the train for a moment before returning it to you, "The first Princesses of Life and Death were not born in the same town. I wasn't able to uncover the complete history behind the royal family, but I did learn enough about your part of the family. In my research, I found that while Princess Celestia is the oldest of the royal pony sisters, followed by Princess Luna, then Princess Vita, the first Princess of Life, then by Princess Thanata, the first Princess of Death, only Princesses Celestia and Luna were born in Equestria's first capitol. When the capitol was moved to Canterlot, Princess Vita was born. While ponies lived and died well before the birth of a Princess of Death, it wasn't until Tramplevania was founded that Princess Thanata was born, when the royal family was visiting the new town, as was the custom back then."

Necrose stops for a moment to clear his throat. While he does this, you think about what he just told you. It's nothing you'd ever heard before, but it still sounds familiar and right, like it makes perfect sense even though you have no idea and don't think to ask how much time passed between the birth of Princess Luna and Princess Vita and then again between the births of Princesses Vita and Thanata. "Anyway," the stallion continues, "before the birth of Princess Vita, death was far more common than it is today. I can't say for certain why this was, as when the three species pony finally came together and founded Equestria, their quality of life took a drastic turn for the better as they began to work together for the benefit of all. Either way, it wasn't until Princess Thanata was born that dying ponies stopped suffering longer than necessary, her role in the lives of mortal ponies to aid them in dying when they are supposed to, as I already said." You nod. This is the part he didn't want to talk about, so rather than asking about whatever it was he didn't want to discuss, you ask him about Tramplevania being the burial place of Princesses of Death. "Yes, about that," Necrose says, looking out the window again, "It seems that the Princesses of the Sun and Moon are eternal as the symbols of their power, the sun and the moon. I don't know why, but it seems the Princesses of Life and Death, and other things such as Love or whatever else an alicorn may be born to help guide Equestria, are as mortal as the rest of us. It seems that the Princess of Death has a longer lifespan than her sister, as Princess Celestia announced, according to the book I read, the death of Princess Vita some years before Princess Luna became Nightmare Moon. Princess Thanata, however, didn't die until a few months after Nightmare Moon was banished. With her dying breath, she declared she wanted to be buried in her hometown of Tramplevania, and of coure, her dying wish was granted." He tells you that in the thousand years between Nightmare Moon's banishment and return then defeat, there had been only one other Princess of Death, and it was she who decreed that should she and her possible successors die, they were to be buried in Tramplevaina as well.

You shake your head. You don't know how to feel. You're alive and will be for many years to come, but you'll outlive many and yet still not hold a candle to Princesses Celestia and Luna. Thinking about all that Necrose had told you and all that happened to get you to this point, you decide you need to change the subject. You like the sound of Thanata as the name of the Princess of Death, so ask about chaging your name to that and your traveling companion tells you that he believes it possible, but you would be better asking Princess Celestia about it, as there is already a name on your tombstone.

You have other questions, and spend the day asking them and getting answers for the ones Necrose can answer, the rest he tells you to save for Princess Celestia, but you can't help but wonder about what about your responsibilities the stallion did not want to discuss.
122312211211211112.title: Let it pass, you have too many other questions.

choices: End the ponies' lives, they're clearly suffering too much
Spare them, though you will willingly not be ending their suffering
1223122112112111121.content:
The train stops with a catastrophic shaking and an ear-piercing screech. You and Necrose are both thrown from your seats, and before you can even get up, the two stallions of the Death Guard who had been posted outside were now inside the cabin and helping you up. You groan as you regain your hooves. It seems being the Princess of Death doesn't make you immune to pain, the throbbing in your chest and forelegs attesting to that quite plainly. You look down to see Necrose sprawled out on the floor but pushing down to get back up, only to collapse under his own weight. It seems he was injured, so you snap at the Death Guard, "Help him up, you fools!" They bark, "Ma'am!" and salute you before attending the black-coated earth pony. They get him up into a sitting position and all at once, it becomes clear that he had in fact injured his left foreleg, likely crushing it under his own weight when he hit the floor. You can't hide the concern in your voice as you ask him if he's alright, and he responds that it's nothing he won't survive.

Before you can ask what happened, a stallion of the general Royal Guard is in the doorway, asking if everypony is alright. You confirm that you are fine, but indicate Necrose hurt his left foreleg, but the earth pony waves his right hoof in dismissal, saying the train's stopping is more important. For a moment, you consider using your status as a Princess to order him to seek help, but deep inside, you know he's right. Trains don't just stop, they have to slow down gradually before coming to a stop. If the train was stopped and it's doing so caused you to be thrown from your seats, that could only mean one thing: train wreck. You ask the Royal Guard what happened, and he states that he does not know, but was on his way to join the others to investigate. You look at Necrose. "We really should find out what the train hit. Or what hit the train," he says, "In any event, we should all be glad this train wreck wasn't worse, or we'd all be dead." He tries to get up into a standing position, but the moment his left hoof touches the floor, he collapses again with a yelp of pain. Without waiting for orders this time, the Death Guard rush to help him stand again, this time helping him stay vertical. "Needing help to stand and walk," the earth pony says, "Pathetic."

All the same, you, Necrose, the Death Guard, and the one Royal Guard depart the car you were in and head forward, toward the front of the train. You can hear shouting the closer to the front you become, and it becomes apparent that whatever caused the train wreck has the Royal Guard in an uproar. Stallions are running back and forth throughout the train, all but ignoring you as they attend to whatever it is each has been tasked with. You're unaware of the chain of command after yourself, but it seems that whoever you may need to be speaking with already has a firm grasp of the situation and had begun mobilizing the guard to help the other riders of the train and investigate and possibly deal with whatever caused the wreck before you left the cabin you were riding in. A guard salutes another stallion before running off and it seems just as well to ask the stationary pony as anypony else what's going on, so you do just that, asking what they know of the current situation. "Don't worry, Princess, it seems the greatest damage to the train was at the point of impact, and as of yet, nopony has reported any serious injuries or fatalities," he says, keeping his eyes on you. You cannot help but breathe a sigh of relief, you're shaken up and now does not feel like a good time to be performing your duties. You may have to, though, as an all too familiar scent enters your nostrils, distracting you from the guard pony and the madness of the scene around you. Somepony is near death. Whatever the impact was, somepony was injured badly enough to possibly die and the sickening sweet scent you smelled last night permeates the air. Part of you wonders if anypony else can smell it, but it hardly seems to matter. Your hooves move almost of their own accord, leaving the guard pony, and soon, you're through the door of the train car and inside the car ahead. The Death Guard carry Necrose behind you, and all at once, the four of you become aware of the terrible scene in the forward-most car after the engine.

A small fire burns as a few guards and several of the ponies who worked on the train lay sprawled about in the lead car, but whatever caused the impact is still not apparent. You inhale deep and take in the scent again. Yes, this is the place, at least one of the ponies in this car is dying and every fiber of your being is screaming at you to end it for them. Before you can grant the dying pony or ponies the peace of oblivion, however, Necrose speaks. "I was afraid of this," he says, his expression every bit as blank as when he greeted you last night, "As the Princess of Death, it is your responsibility to end the suffering of dying ponies. This cannot be understated. And here you have ponies who may in fact need you. However, you need not necessarily end them. It is your responsibility to do so, and I'm sure they would be grateful to you if you did, but, as royalty, it is your prerogative whether or not you do so. Some may see it as cruelty, others may glean hope for survival from your inaction, but it is you, Princess, who decides when and whether you end ponies' suffering. If you choose to do so, do it. Otherwise, do not act and let them be, though I fear without the new Princess of Life here to ensure they do survive, they may die in agony greater than had you performed your duty."

You look at the ponies on the floor. Clearly, they are injured and the looks on their faces indicate to you that there is in fact some major suffering going on here, and you stand at a crossroads of a sort. The more obvious injuries are bad, indeed, but it's otherwise hard to tell just how close to death even without you these ponies are. You could kill them, but suppose they're supposed to survive? How would you know that? You ask Necrose and he shrugs. "Without the Princess of Life here," he says, looking at you now, "it is hard to tell. I'm sorry, but it is your decision."
1223122112112111121.title: Train Wreck!

choices: Inquire among the pegasi on board
Go yourself
12231221121121111211.content:
You stammer through your proclamation of intent. You'll do it, but only for the worst injured ponies as some are already dragging themselves up while others still lay on the floor. One is badly burned, apparently having been standing close to where the fire, now burned itself out, had started after the impact that stopped the train. You look to Necrose for some guidance, he's the most knowledgable pony here about alll this, but he only shrugs. The earth pony apologizes and says that you must know some magic to painlessly end it for them, or that you could do so manually. All things considered, you wouldn't want to and can't kill everypony by fucking them to death, so you instead focus on magic. You'd never done it before, never having had a horn before your transformation, but if it's all related to being the Princess of Death, you know you have to learn sometime.

The burned pony's breathing is shallow and the scent you're starting to enjoy does in fact emanate from him. His eyes screwed shut from the pain of the burns and his other injuries, he doesn't see your approach, but feels it when you touch your horn to his temple. He stirs, and you shush him with a soothing voice. "Hush now, it's time to rest," you look over to Necrose again, who gives no indication whether you are doing it right or wrong, then continue, "I'm. . . Princess Thanata the Second and I'm here to end your suffering." The stallion nods slightly and rasps, "Please..." and falls silent again. You focus on your horn, trying to will a spell into existence, and it glows a sickening purple as your intended spell takes form. When you feel it's ready, you will the spell onto the burned pony, who gasps and with his last breath, exhales a, "Thank you." then he stops, dead, suffering no longer. You turn to face Necrose, who nods. "I'm curious, Princess, how did you do it?" You have to think, how did you do it? "I don't really know," you start, still puzzling through it. "When I touched my horn to his temple and began casting, I could feel his heartbeat, so I guess I felt for that first? And then feeling that to be weak, I guess I just kind of used my spell to stop his heart." You pause and a puzzled expression crosses your face. "Is this what using magic is like?" The earth pony, now standing under his own strength, taps his forehead and says he's not the pony to ask. "But Princesses Celestia and Luna and a great many unicorns can," he says, then indicates the rest of the ponies laying on the floor, "I don't presume to tell a Princess what to do, but what do you intend to do with them?"

You look around, only three remain on the floor in varying states of injury and the scent of death isn't as strong anymore. Indeed, it seems to be dissipating by the second. "I know this sounds crazy," you sigh, not knowing how best to proceed, "but I can. . . I can smell when death is near and I'm not smelling it in here anymore. I think the only one in danger was the one I just killed. I-I don't think it's a good idea to kill them, Necrose." The undertaker bows before you. "As you wish, Princess," he begins, but before he can say anything else, a guard pony enters the cabin and reports on the situation. He coveys the train narrowly missed being swept away in a rocky avalanche and while the engine car was lost, the engineer along with it, this car was the only one damaged and these were the only ponies injured or killed. "Thank you," you say, "Can the Royal Guard help the injured to the rear cars?" The reporting guard and the others, excluding the Death Guard who remain on either side of Necrose, salute you and begin carrying out your request.

One Royal Guard, the stallion everypony else was reporting to earlier, remains. He introduces himself as Shining Star and asks for your orders. You're inclined to ask how bad the avalanche was and how long it would take to clear, but with no engine, it would be pointless to try to get the train to Canterlot. Instead, you ask how far outside Tramplevania the train is and Shining Star replies that a fast enough flyer could make it there in less than an hour. He also indicates that nopony not already on the train yet seems to know about the avalanche and that it would be a good idea to send somepony to Tramplevania to make the report and bring back help. You agree and decide to
12231221121121111211.title: Death Becomes Them

122312211211212.content: She doesn't hesitate. Death licks her lips,and jumps towards you. Razor sharp teeth clamp unto your spinal cord, making your death swift. You float in an endless void, blackness everywhere. You have lost. This is your punishment. Endless nothing. Forever.
122312211211212.title: Is... not satisfied. Maybe she'll give you ...

choices: Time.
Space.
122312211212.content:
Without waiting for luna's approval, you trot down the hallway, grinning broadly. The hall is short, and at the end are two statues, one an hourglass, one a swath of the night sky, complete with twinkling stars.

You reach out a hoof, towards the Time one. It begins to glow, and you feel....drawn towards it. Your thoughts begin to grow fuzzy, stretched out, and it's almost like they're taking ages to crawl there way into the front of your mind. In a panic, and with a gargantuan amount of effort, you yank your hoof away. The force you exert knocks you back several feet when at last you pop free. Shaking your head, you decide that Time is a hair too much trouble.

Reaching for the Space bust, you feel your thoughts get distorted, words twisting an turning through a broken mirror. With reserves of strength you never knew you had, you yank your hoof free.

Finally you furrow your brow. This time, your decision is final. You reach for.....
122312211212.title: Time and Space!

choices: Do the honorable thing and wait for her to free her weapon.
Screw honour! Lay into her straightaway.
1223122112121.content:
You reach a hoof out for the bust of time. Before you can even make contact, your vision suddenly flashes to white.

The whiteness is slow to recede. The center of your vision is the first to clear- a small pinpoint of…dimly lit…sepia?

Your hearing returns to you swiftly as you dimly begin to make out the sound of clocks.

Hundreds upon hundreds of clocks, slowly ticking in perfect unison. All of them hung on the walls of a massive circular open pit you seem to be in.

You look up, confused. Far, far abve you is a swirling void of liquid amber and brown and gold, twisting and turning peculiarly. It’s a huge circle contained right above the current, stadium-sized pit. Surrounding it is a black void, and bissarely, there seems to be a small red…cork, almost….floating below the liquid gold. The view is funny…almost like your looking at the black void and the gold through curved glass.

Your musings are interrupted by an almighty chiming sound, snapping your focus to ground level.

All the clocks announcing the time with a thunderous peal, all simultaneously telling you the hour has come.

Wait, what?

“Finally! I was getting bored. Okay, I wasn’t- it’s been about five minutes since I destroyed the last one. Good soul on that one too, not too twisted, with some good marbling on the edges.”

you turn your head. Seated on a strange, twisted throne of brass and topped with hourglasses and other timepieces, an amber alicorn with polished black armour from hoof to horn reclines lazily. In one hoof, the alicorn is twisting and untwisting a silver thread, and in the other….

You recoil. Her other hoof rests upon the hilt of a bloody black sword.

Her coat shimmers and swirls like the strange substance overhead, and her mane is flowing gently in a nonexistent breeze. Your eyes dart back to the sword.

It’s a long, onyx thorn with malice seemingly exuding from it’s edges. The blood along the length seems to be there on-purpose- the alicorn before you has not bothered to clean it off.

You look up to meet her eyes as she stands and steps from her throne. She’s actually quite scary, especially up close like this.

She curtly offers a hoof to you to shake. Confused, you gingerly accept.

“I am the Force of Time.” She states proudly, “and I take it you are here to challenge me for my power? All the others have been. It’s been a while since one came for tea and cookies.”

You gulp. “Y…yeah. I’m here for that.”

She smiles fiercely. “Excellent! It’s been a while since I have sampled a soul of an alicorn- I usually have to subsist off of scraps from the mortal plane.”

She focuses, closing her eyes and allowing her horn to glow. A strange object begins to take shape in the miasma, before solidifying and floating over to you.

It’s a white sword.

“The challenge will commence as a duel to the death! Whoever can rent their opponent asunder shall claim her prize.” She announced with an icy smile.

She grabs her silver thread, and yanks it.

Hard.

The red cork comes falling an improbable distance, meteorite entering earth.

And it’s heading straight for you!

You leap aside as the cork tears the rocky floor a craterlike asshole, and spin to face your opponent as a stream of sand begins to pour from the sky.

You’re in the bottom of a giant hourglass.

Time seizes the moment, leaping towards you, blade wrapped tightly in her telekinesis. The black thorn dances, speeding toward your head. You duck, and thrust up your blade for a parry. The two meet in a bone-splintering clang!

The sword is knocked from your weak telekinesis like a beer slapped from a drunk.

It sails away, spinning on the floor-
About to be swallowed by a swiftly growing pile of sand!

You dodge another of her attacks, charging towards the white thorn- your only salvation. Scooping it up in your hooves, you snarl a bit. Screw telekinesis- until today, when you got in a fight, you used your hooves. Ain’t nothing gonna change now.

You spin and swiftly parry and overhead chop that would have bashed your skull in. Her magic is strong, pushing the blade downwards like a five-ton guillotine.

You’re stronger. You’re an earth pony, for Celestia’s sake.

Deciding to take the risk of breaking the block, you yank the sword out and jump out of harm’s way. Time looks decidedly shocked as her weapon rapidly speeds into the floor, before getting lodged.

She tugs at her weapon, desperately trying to get it free. The blade is sunk into the floor deeply, though, and it looks like it’s not getting out without a fight.

You have a choice to make.
1223122112121.title: Time.

12231221121211.content:
You patiently wait, tap-tap-tapping a hoof in time to the tick-tick-ticking of the clock.

With an almighty blast of telekinesis, Time triumphantly wrenches the black blade from the floor with a thunderous crack. Lightning strikes the blade as she faces you.

The two of you leap into the fray, frenzied hacking and slashing as the blades connect in a whirling frenzy of all-consuming rage.

You aim for Time’s head. She blocks rapidly, and thrusts a stab towards your chest. You can’t remember how to parry a stab, and with the blade rapidly approaching you duck out of the way. The blade whizzes by you harmlessly, but nonetheless a chuckle escapes her lips.

Time twirls her blade a little, before beginning to attack exclusively with stabs.
You gulp. Stab left! Dodge! Stab at head! Dodge!

Her blade moves like the needle of a sewing machine, a black blur that whizzes between the two of you. It whistles like a bullwhip, slowly cornering you in to one of the walls of the hourglass stadium.
You feel your rump touch up against the wall.

Wait! Wings! You’ve got wings! You spread them frantically, flapping with all your might. But try as you might, the truth is, you have no idea how to use these stupid things!

You turn to her, terrified…..

The last thing you hear before the black blade rams through your chest is a sadistic chuckle.

You’re dead.

BAD END.
12231221121211.title: The honourable way.

choices: "...Canterlot castle. Equestria must know of you immediately!"
"...The magic school- you must learn about your new powers!"
12231221121212.content:
You smile evilly. Charging forward, you toss your sword and decide to give her the goods like you used to do down on the farm.

Your hooves thunder across the floor, head tilted forwards to perform a deadly bash. Time gasps in shock as she sees you charging, and her horn glows. You feel yourself slowed. Time is moving at hyperspeed outside of your little bubble of temporal lethargy, yanking and pulling at the sword at speeds that would give a pony whiplash.

It’s irrelevant. You’ve started the charge- no backing out now. Your friends back when you were little gave you the nickname Orange Thunder for your relentlessness in a fight.

You keep powering onwards as if through cherry syrup, hooves striking the floor with speed and power each time.

Outside your bubble of slowness, Time is actively terrified for once in her existence as a Force. As she looks at her blade, she decides to sever all other spells into one final burst of telekinetic might.

In your bubble you slooowly cock an eyebrow as the outside world seems to slow down. And then, her horn flares red, a corona of overcasting surrounding it as the sword is wrenched from the floor with an almighty crack. Triumphant, she turns to you-

And realizes that you have forgotten one key little detail.

You’re an alicorn. You have a horn.

You slam into her with the force of a train crash, horn spearing deep into her chest. Unfortunately for Time, you’re currently on autopilot- and autopilot has no clue you’ve already won. You buck your head upwards, power flowing through your muscles as you hurl her upwards and allow her to plummet to the floor.

WHAM!

The twisted form lands in the dust near the sandpile. It seems to have grown tenfold during the battle- time-twisting is really annoying.

You trot over to her.

The body of Time lies in the dirt. You raise and eyebrow at the corpse- the swirling currents of her coat seem to be pouring out the hole in the chest and leaving behind….

A clear, empty shell.

You gasp a bit as the currents begin to swirl around you, sinking slowly into your body. The golden swirls are particles now, slowly flowing into you. You feel your mane begin to flow gently, caressed by the winds of change and the currents of time.

Your vision flashes white, and so do your eyes- caster’s glow in reverse. The remaining power continued in the body before you flashes upwards in an almighty golden column of light, before rocketing floor-ward and striking you full in the face.

You reel backwards, stunned, as the sheer power courses through your veins. Time itself seems to flow before you- all that is and was and ever will be, presenting itself to you. You feel yourself begin to ebb and flow with the river- your status as a singular point on the time stream just got updated.

As infinity begins to slowly fade away from your view, you blink a few times.

The floor beneath your feet is the cave. You look around, eyes resting on the bust of Time.

It’s glowing.

You slowly trot out of the cavern, towards Celestia and Luna. They look pleased to see you, and congratulate you on your victory.

“come along,” Luna says, “we should go to….”
12231221121212.title: Screw honour! Lay into her straightaway.

choices: Hop on the bed!
Tell him you like mares more.
1223122112122.content:
You reach out suddenly, jabbing your hoof at the bust of space.

Your world goes bright white and falls away from you. you black out.

Slowly you open your eyes. The ground beneath you is a dark blue and a pale blue...the undulating colours across the floor are ....mesmerising.

You yank your gaze away from the floor and look up. The ceiling overhead is starry, but the pattern ripples- lines and other eddies swirl and tumble among them floating in the immdiate forground are everything from boxes to islands to ponies. It's a train crash of everything from everywhere in the universe.

"Why, hello there!" You peel your eyes away from the chaos towards the voice. Your head turns, and you gasp at the sight of a stallion, made entirely of Space.

Eddies in existence flow over his...skin, swirling and tumbling through the alternating blackness and pinpoints of the stars before finnally rippling to a halt in his mane. His eyes are normally sized and both of them are currently focused on you. He trots toward you.

He grins. The white of his teeth and eyes are in stark contrast to the rest of his body.

"H....hello." You stammer. "A...Luna...."

He snorts a little. "Luna? Did she tell you you had to subjugate or coerce me to get your power?"

You dumbly nod.

He rolls his eyes. "Typical. here's the deal, sweetums- I don't do subjugate. but my power is yours if you can....." He walks right up to you and grins, this time amourously.

"shall we say....coerce this here star-cock." he points between his hind legs. your jaw drops as you stare at it. it's huge, two feet long- why does he need htat much? and jsut like the rest of his body, made of stars.

You shake your head. "Power for pleasure? that sounds like a really bad deal, at least for you." You say, cocking an eyebrow. "So...what's the catch?"

He waggles his eyebrows. "You're stuck here until I let you go. and that's not gonna happen until I'm one hundred percent satisfied. After that, I merge with you and we leave. simple transaction. one more thing though....we can come back here anytime I want."

Your jaw drops.

To make the offer all the more concrete, Space turns away from you and warps into existence a gorgeous bed easily big enough for the both of you, plus two. he hops up on the bed and pats it.

You:
1223122112122.title: Space.

choices: Follow her to the bedroom
Suggest you 'rest' here in the Throne Room
122312212.content:
You find yourself in the throne room.
"Alicorns are very rare," Celestia explains. "Only a member of royalty can be born as an alicorn, and... well, never, in all my time as princess, have I seen or heard of somepony becoming one."
Everypony keeps saying that. You're starting to feel a little self-conscious. That is forgotten, however, at Celestia's next words:
"Therefore, I believe it to be best you stay here in the castle, at least until we find out more about this."
"O-okay," you stammer. You're extremely excited, but you almost can't believe this is really happening.
She smiles. "Good. I'll arrange a room for you. In the mean time--"
"Sister," Luna interrupts, "Perhaps it would be better if... she stayed with us, in our room. For observation." The last part she adds quickly, trying to hide the blush on her face.
You're perfectly fine and would tell them if not for the fact that it is clearly an excuse, and besides, who would object to any reason to stay with the princesses? Dirty thoughts go through your mind and you shift your hind legs awkwardly, hoping for it to go unnoticed.
Celestia looks at you and, between her expression and Luna's blushing, you wonder if you're all thinking more or less the same thing. You certainly hope so. "Yes, I believe that may be a good idea. Her face does look a little flushed. In fact, perhaps we should all... get some rest... now."
You know that that 'rest' can only actually mean one thing...
122312212.title: Into the Castle

choices: ...Queen Chrysalis!
...Nightmare Moon!?
1223122122.content:
You almost dare not suggest it - you are, after all, going to be with the princesses of Canterlot, so who are you to suggest anything? And yet, you do. "Why don't we just rest here?"
Celestia raises an eyebrow, wondering if you honestly didn't pick up on what she meant. "Here?" She looks closely at your expression and realizes it then. "Ohh... you're a naughty pony, aren't you?" she says, quietly enough that you can barely hear her despite being next to her.
"What?" Luna asks, having not heard.
"I was saying that I think that sounds like a fine idea," she replies. She glances over to the guards, thinking. "Luna, take care of the guards, okay?" She described a harmless wild goose chase to send them on that should keep them busy for at least an hour or so. In a whisper, she adds, "In exchange, I will reward you tonight. Perhaps all three of us."
Luna nods. While it was a rare occurrence, neither sister minded sharing the other with a different pony if that's what they wished. And threesomes could be quite fun. So, she leads the guards in their quest.
"Now, as for you..." She smiles seductively at you.
"Your wish is my command, Princess," you tell her with a bow.
She likes that but does not tell you so. Instead, she puts a hand on your flank and instructs, "Spread your hind legs."
You do as she says. She begins to lick your marehood, sending waves of pleasure through your body. A moan escapes you.
"Shh!" she says quickly. "I'd rather not be overheard."
You lightly bite into the almost pillow-like cushion of the throne. You've heard of ponies doing that with pillows to stifle sounds and it seems like the best solution at the moment.
The white alicorn seems quite experienced as her tongue moves expertly inside of you. You can feel your body, including your new wings, beginning to tense. Not long after, all that tension releases. Celestia can vaguely make out her name as you exclaim it into the throne cushion.
You remove your mouth from the cushion and, still breathing hard, get behind Celestia. She briefly looks back before positioning herself for you. You start at the outer lips, then work your way towards the most sensitive part. When your tongue touches that, she gasps lightly in pleasure and her back arches. She is trying to keep her voice silent, or at least as quiet as possible, but as you continue, this becomes rather difficult.
Celestia reaches her climax and can't quite stop herself from crying out. At the same time, the doors behind them open with a forceful thud. You both quickly turn to look, hoping it's just Luna having ditched the guards. A pony's silhouette becomes visible in the doorway and as she approaches, you see that it is...
1223122122.title: Suggest you 'rest' here in the Throne Room

choices: You transgendered her!
You... inflated her?
12231222.content:
You feel it well up in your brain, like some kind of terrible blood rush. You're left feeling lightheaded and dizzy. The room seems to spin around you, you lose your balance and tumble off the bed onto the floor. You bring both of your slender hooves up to the base of your newly formed horn and try to massage the growing pressure away, but it only seems to make it worse. The whole area is incredibly sensitive, like, like a second clitoris!

"Oh dear!" You're in too much pain to open your eyes, but you recognize Nurse Redheart's voice. "What's happening to her now? I think she's going into shock, hold her down and make sure she doesn't swallow her tongue!"

"No, wait." Twilight presses a hoof to the base of your horn and rubs it a little. The sensation worsens and you start to pant for breath. "She's got a buildup of magical energy. She hasn't had a chance to exercise her horn, so it's just backed up! We need to release it."

"So, uuugh," You pull yourself off the ground, "I just have to cast a spell or something?"

"Erm, no," she says, "it's unfortunately not that simple. You're so backed up that we need to manually release it."

You're not liking the sound of this, "When you say manuall you mean what exactly?"

The unicorn blushes, and leans over to Nurse Redheart. She whispers something in her ear that makes her eyes go wide. if you weren't nervous already, seeing a magical prodigy and a medical official flushed with embarrassment will certainly do it.

"That can't be an actual medical procedure." Redheart protests. But Twilight begs to differ.

"It's less medical and more magical." She says, "I've had to have the princess help me in such a way on a few occasions."

Redheart still isn't convinced, "Do we both have to?"

"It will go much quicker."

You can't stand not knowing what they're planning for a second longer. You force your(considerably large) body between them and use your wings to push them apart. Then you stamp your hooves on the ground and say,

"Now wait a minute! I want to know what the heck you guys are talking about this instant!"

You snap your head towards Nurse Redheart and give her your most intimidating face. Perhaps being so large played a part, but she shrunk away from you almost instantly. You turn towards Twilight and get the same response, if only for a moment. Twilight turns out to be a bit more courageous and steps forward to offer you a bit of an explanation,

"You see Orange Cream, the horn on a unicorn or alicorn both function very similar to a sex organ, if you can believe that." She seems like she can't believe she's explaining this to you either, "Yours is built up and we need to relieve it."

"You're joking." You lean down and point your horn to her. "This." You point a hoof at the horn. "Is going into you??

"My mouth." Twilight says, "I'm not going to enjoy this, if it makes you feel better."

"So, what, are you just going to- whoah mama!" Twilight was apparently done answering questions, because you felt her lips wrap around the very tip of your slender horn. She wasn't lying, the sensation was incredible. You felt all that pressure rise upwards, from the base of your horn to the tip. It starts to glow bright and Twilight pulls her mouth off it.

"What is she doing?" Redheart panics.

"Ssooo good!" You scream out in guilty pleasure. The magical energy floods out of your horn and shoots like a bottle rocket across the room. Redheart, still awestruck by the whole event, is caught off guard. It almost looks like she was going to get blasted with your magical payload but Twilight Sparkle seemed to see all this coming and tackled Redheart, bumping her out of the way of the blast at the price of taking the blast herself.

You come off your cloudy high of orgasm and suddenly realize that you just blasted an innocent unicorn with a concentrated dosage of.. Of... What spell did you cast anyway?
12231222.title: Magical Alicorn Mayonnaise

choices: Next day
Middle of the night
122312221.content:
It would seem like Twilight blinked a few times and then almost immediately she lost consciousness but it didn't stop there. In another blink of an eye, this time yours,.Twilight body became bulkier but not by much. But the most noticeable change was and you blinked the third time to double check is that she grew a penis. A few seconds later the air around the organ shimmered making it disappear in the thin air.

"Decency filter spell, what the hey," you mumbled to yourself. As a former earth pony you did pride yourself to be educated, Decency spell was offered as part of the sex education classes and to no surprise almost every unicorn used it from time to time. "Also, what the hey I made her into dude," your eyes widened and then you continued to speak. "Oh my gosh, I probably should apologize to her."

Nurse Redheart had a very tired look, her weirdness meter was slightly over the limit, after all this was a little bit over the top. "You do that, but first she needs to wake up first." She picked up Twilight's body and then deposited her on the nearby patient bed and then left to do the paperwork leaving you to your own devices

Your previous issues did seem to be completely minuscule considering what just happened and to be fair you didn't exactly planning to stay in the hospital forever. So maybe to just sit and wait for the only pony who might help you to adopt to your current situation. You wondered if Twilight's transformation was permanent.

She would kill me if it was, you though to yourself with horror. Even if she would spare you out of the goodness of your heart, her family would certainly do just that. Especially if she somehow had an overprotective brother. You forced yourself to calm down, eventually your eyes closed, and then you fell asleep.
122312221.title: You transgendered her!

choices: Go for the medical pumps, and hope you get there in time!
Try some magic! You caused this, so you can fix it... Probably!
122312222.content:
Twilight Sparkle lays on her side, legs straddling a purple balloon. Wait, balloon? You blink, but it remains. It's only when Twilight stirs, causing the balloon to slosh that you realize it's attached to her, and another moment for your mind to fully grasp that it's not a balloon - It's her belly! Twilight tried to get up, causing her hooves to sink into her bloated middle.

"Wha-" She starts, only to double over in pain as a sickening gurgle rises from her bloated gut. She opens her mouth, but before she can get another word out, her belly begins to expand, bloating like a balloon on a high pressure hose. An ear-piercing shriek rends the air - Two of them, from both Twilight and Redheart, who simply stares in shock at the swelling unicorn. Scrambling upright is a challenge, but somehow, she makes it just in time for her hooves to lose contact with the floor. She's equal parts mare and belly, with a swift trend moving toward the second.

Her horn ignites, and suddenly, there's a ripple, followed by a strange sloshing sound, and before your very eyes, the magical mass within Twilight's belly seems to equalize, spreading throughout her body. Her flanks swell up, growing wider and rounder than most hayburger addicts, while her legs bloat into stiff, barely-moveable balloons. Even her chin and cheeks expand, growing big enough to muffle the speech escaping from her steadily plumping lips.

"What have you done to mrph?" You'd love to know the same thing - There's no balloon spell in your repertoire, at least, none that you know of! It could be some kind of effect of your new alicorn magic, or maybe a strange interaction with Twilight's internal magical reservoir. You've heard of one spell accidentally activating another unicorn's magic, but those were always things like levitation, not this!

"We-we need to get something," Redheart shouts, barely audible over the creaking and groaning of Twilight's massive body, "A pump! We've got medical pumps in the storage closet, I'll go grab one and-"

"D-do something! I-I'm g-gonna burst!" A shower of sparks spews forth from her horn. Some land across the floor, melting through the linoleum, while others burst harmlessly into stardust mid-air. You dive out of the way of one, but Redheart isn't quite as lucky, taking multiple sparks to the torso, burning holes in her coat, but causing no other immediate effect. For a moment, she stares down at herself, and you almost think she's going to be alright - Then, she screams, and begins to expand.
